recipies.description: This pickle is a spice lover's dream come true. Whole chillies stuffed with a host of sizzling spices make this Banarasi preparation a popular one.
recipies.name: Lal Mirch ka Benarsi Achaar
method: Remove the stalk of the red peppers cutting around the base of the stalk, thus creating an opening to fill them.
Mix together, everything, except the oil and the red peppers.
Add 1/4 cup of the oil and rub it into the mixture.
Stuff this mixture into the red peppers, pressing the filling in firmly, so that it is tightly stuffed.
Dip each red pepper into the oil and place in the container, one by one.
Pour the remainder oil over to cover the red peppers. Keep it under the sun for about a week.

recipies.description: This spiced lemon pickle can work wonders for your boring meals.
ingredients: 2 kg lemons, washed, wiped and chopped
100 gm chilli powder or to taste
50 gm fenugreek seeds (methi dana), finely ground
recipies.name: South Indian Lemon Pickle
method: Heat 60 gm (1 cup) oil and add the lemons and saute for about 10 minutes over low heat.
Add salt and chilli powder, saute for another 10 minutes
Add fenugreek seeds, asafoetida and turmeric and the remaining oil, bring to a boil, lower the heat and cook for 10 minutes.
Take it off the heat and store in a clean airtight jar when cool.
Gets softer when matured for 10-15 days.

recipies.description: Paranthas with the liberal helping of eggs, onion, green chilies and coriander leaves.
ingredients: 2 cups water to knead the dough
Dry flour to help with rolling
recipies.name: Mughlai Paratha
method: Mix the whole-wheat flour, refined flour and the two tablespoons of
Knead into a soft, sticky dough and cover and leave aside for 2-3 hours.
Divide the dough into 4 rounds, cover and leave to rest for about 15 minutes.
Heat a griddle over the stove. While it is getting hot, roll out one round.
The dough is sticky and soft, so you may need to dust it with flour frequently. Better still, pat it thin with your palms if you can.
Keeping the heat on high, place the
Lower heat to medium. To seal, fold over four ways towards the center, so that the ends overlap, thus forming a square.
Make a trail of
When the underside is fried, smear the top with a generous helping of
Serve hot with a chutney or yoghurt.

recipies.description: Dough balls stuffed with dal mixture, rolled out and made into paranthas.
recipies.name: Dal ka Paratha
method: Sieve the flour and knead to a soft dough by adding enough water. Keep aside.
Drain the
When the seeds splutter, add the cooked dal, salt, turmeric powder, chilli powder and mix well.
Cook until the
Break small rounds of the dough. Roll each round a little flat and place some filling in center.
Close from all sides and roll as thin as you can without tearing.
Heat a

recipies.description: Easy, quick and yum, no wonder this recipe refuses to die down.
recipies.name: Grilled Cheese Sandwich
method: Mix cheese, salt,
Butter the bread slices.
Place half each of the cheese mixture over two slices, on the unbuttered side.
Cover both with the other slices, buttered side on top.
Grill and serve.

recipies.description: Thousand Island Sauce is frequently used as a dressing for salads. It is made with mayonnaise, chilli powder and tomato ketchup. Egg and celery are added in this recipe to give some flavor.
recipies.name: Thousand Island Sauce
method: Place all the ingredients in the jar of a liquidizer and blend.

recipies.description: Finger Millets (Ragi) is grown in the Himalayas and are usually inter-cropped with peanuts. Here's a yummy ladoo recipe from the wholesome, healthy produce with coconut, jaggery and crunchy peanuts.
recipies.name: Ragi Coconut Ladoo
method: Take the flour and salt in a bowl and sprinkle water little by little whilst mixing it but breaking them into crumbs as you keep mixing.
Mix in the coconut. Steam the mixture with coconut for 10-15 minutes.
Lay the mixture onto a tray and let it cool.
Blend the jaggery with the flour mixture and peanuts.
Roll them into lemon-sized balls and devour!

recipies.description: Oranges and lemons, fresh on the table. A delicious citrus marmalade to perk up your breakfast.
recipies.name: Orange Marmalade
method: Squeeze the juice of the oranges and lemons. Cook the juice along with water over a moderate flame.
Remove membrane, pips and pith from the fruit and tie securely inside a muslin bag.
Shred peel into strips and add to the juice along with the muslin bag.
Cook juice until the liquid has evaporated by 1/3. Add sugar and dissolve. Boil rapidly until setting point is reached.
Drop in butter and skim out any impurities from the surface.
Store in a cool and dry jar.
The pips tied in the bag, help produce pectin so you do not need to add any.

recipies.description: Zesty bell pepper chutney that can be paired with a range of dishes.
recipies.name: Peach and Bell Pepper Chutney
method: In a big pan, add a little olive oil and fry a clove, fennel seeds, black peppercorns, cinnamon stick, cumin powder, star anise, black peppercorns and ½ a dried red chilli.
Add the chopped onions, minced ginger, bell peppers and the peach along with a big pinch of orange zest.
Add the jaggery and rice wine vinegar.
Reduce till the vinegar has reduced.
Cook for 10 minutes until the onions and peppers are soft but not mushy.
Add the juice of half an orange.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Add chopped mint and coriander leaves.

recipies.description: This Middle Eastern staple can be an appetizer or an accompaniment to a main course of grilled chicken.
recipies.name: Hummus
method: Soak the chick peas overnight and boil with little salt.
Drain and keep some liquid for
Add all the ingredients in a mixie except the paprika and blend to form a smooth paste, adding olive oil gradually.
Garnish with some more olive oil and paprika.
Serve with pita bread and sauteed vegetables.

recipies.description: Tomato based zingy goodness.
recipies.name: Oriental Sauce
method: To prepare the sauce, combine all ingredients and serve.
Tip: It goes well with chicken in lettuce parcels.

recipies.description: Carrots and condensed milk cooked in a microwave and finished with almonds and raisins. A divine Indian dessert perfect for a wintery evening.
recipies.name: Microwave Gajar Ka Halwa
method: Place the carrots and condensed milk in a dish, mix well, cover and cook on High for 5 minutes, stirring once.
Cook, covered on 50 per cent for 10 minutes, stirring twice.
Continue cooking and stirring every two minutes till the carrots start appearing slightly glossy and the moisture has evaporated.
Add the cardamom and

recipies.description: Here's the recipe for Pakistan's preferred dessert, Golden Rasmalai. Small balls made of paneer, flour and milk dipped in a khoya-milk gravy.
recipies.name: Golden Rasmalai
method: Take fresh paneer, flours, sugar and all ingredients in a bowl and mash well.
Make small balls out of the mixture.
Make a sugar syrup with 1 1/2 cup water and 1/2 cup sugar. Add these small balls to the sugar syrup. Cook for 10 minutes.
To make rabdhi, take 2 ltr milk. Reduce it to 1 1/2 ltr. Then add khoya, 2 cups sugar, saffron and reetha powder. Cook on low flame for 10-15 minutes. Cool down to room temperature.
Then add the small balls to this rabdhi, and put in refrigerator to chill.
Sprinkle mint and crushed nuts on rabdhi. Put golden vark on top.

recipies.description: Wheat flour, semolina and jaggery come together to make a quick and easy halwa.
recipies.name: Gur Aur Atte Ka Halwa
method: Take desi ghee in a pan. Add in cloves for tempering.
Stir fry wheat flour and semolina together until golden brown.
Add jaggery and saute.
In another pan, boil equal parts milk and water with saffron.
When flour and semolina start releasing fragrance, add the milk and water.
Cook till done, then cool to room temperature and mix in raisins.

recipies.description: Delicious semolina ladoos made with some crunchy dry fruits.
recipies.name: Rava Ladoo
method: Heat 1 tbsp
Grind the mixture and add sugar, cardamom powder, melted
Make small balls out of the
Garnish with chopped nuts and decorate with silver leaf.

recipies.description: An innovative and tangy dip made with pomegranates, tamarind and crushed rose petals.
recipies.name: Pomegranate Chutney
method: Grind all the ingredients together.
Garnish with poppy seeds powder and serve.

recipies.description: Chutney made from bhaang seeds, mint leaves and green chillies.
recipies.name: Bhaang ki Chutney
method: Roast the bhang seeds and then grind them in a mixie.
Add the green chillies, lemon juice, mint leaves, water and salt and grind to a paste in a mixie.
The

recipies.description: Who doesn't love a freshly made jam on the dining table? A fruity delight that smoothly spreads on the toasted bread. This apple jam is easy to make and preservative free.
ingredients: 1/4 cup lemon juice or to taste
recipies.name: Apple Jam
method: Put the apples in a steel or glass container, cover with water and keep overnight.
Transfer to a heavy-based sauce pan, bring to a boil and cook till soft.
Strain through a soup strainer or blend and strain.
Put back onto the stove and bring to a boil again and cook, stirring to avoid scorching.
When slightly thinner than jam consistency, add the sugar, lemon juice and
Lower the heat and keep stirring till sugar is dissolved (not letting it coming to a boil before that).
When sugar is dissolved, bring to a boil and cook, stirring all the time (else it will caramelize at the bottom and change flavour).
When a drop placed over a cold surface sets, the jam is ready.
Store in sterilized, airtight jars.

recipies.description: Healthy ladoos made with ragi flour, oats flour, honey, dates and milk. Coated with sesame seeds and coconut. Oh yum!
recipies.name: Ragi Oats Ladoo
method: Dry roast the oats lightly and grind them in a mixer.
Remove the seeds from the dates and blend 15 of them with the help of milk in a blender into a paste.
Cut the remaining dates into small pieces.
Dry roast white sesame seeds.
Dry roast cashew nuts.
Take 1 tbsp of ghee in pan and roast the oats flour on low flame for few minutes.
Now take another pan and heat the remaining ghee and roast ragi flour until the rawness is removed on low flame.
Now mix the oats flour in the ragi flour and mixwell keeping on low flame.
Now add the dates paste into it and mi well.
Then add half of honey and mix.
Now add cardamom powder and mix well. Keep on low flame for few minutes and off the stove.
Take the mixture out of stove and let it cool for some time.
Now add the pieces of dates.
Now add the remaining honey and mix well into dough.
Now take some dough into hand and put a cashew and make it in the form of ladoo.
Mix the sesame seeds in to coconut powder.
Now roll the ladoo in this mixture and coat it.
Do the same with remaining dough and serve them.

recipies.description: Enjoy warm goodness of halwa flavored with dates and cashew nuts with this easy recipe.
recipies.name: Dates Halwa
method: Place milk and dates in a pan and bring to a boil.
Lower the heat and cook till thick.
Fry the cashew nuts in half the ghee and keep aside.
When dates mixture is thick (looks blended), add the sugar, ghee, and cashews and cook further till mixture leaves sides of pan.
Add the
When cool and set, slice into desired sized pieces and serve.

recipies.description: A very simple halwa made from dhoodi, soy milk and garnished with pistachios.
recipies.name: Doodhi ka Halwa
method: In a kadai, steer margarine, butter and dhoodi together.
Steer them and reduce them.
Add jaggery into this mix.
In a sauce pan, boil soy milk and chopped almonds together.
Add the milk mix into the kadai.
Mix all ingredients well.
Garnish it with chopped pistachio.
Serve hot.

recipies.description: A beautiful looking beetroot raita. With the crunch of cucumbers and onions, this pink colored raita is best served chilled with hot paranthas or pulao.
recipies.name: Beetroot Raita
method: In a blender add the curd and  beetroot puree. Mix. Strain in a bowl. Should be pink in color.
Add the chopped onions, cucumbers and salt to the bowl. Mix.
Garnish it with chopped coriander leaves.

recipies.description: This fancy dish is a spinach kebab served with some divine tostadas! Don't miss out on the masala popcorn.
recipies.name: Sarson Ki Gilawat with Corn and Cheese Tostadas
method: Take
Add
Add
Add roasted
Cook the
For corn tostadas, add coriander to chopped corn and stuff inside small dough to make tostada.
Serve

recipies.description: A quick and easy vegetarian dish that is perfect for a busy weeknight. Spinach greens tossed in canola oil and tempered with garlic, ginger and chillies.
recipies.name: Khada Desi Palak
method: Wash and blanch spinach.
In heavy bottom pan, heat canola oil. Temper with cumin seeds and garlic. Let garlic turn golden brown, then add ginger, chillies and spinach.
Quickly toss over high flame so spinach wilts off nicely but does not overcook to lose flavors.
Taste for seasoning before serving.
Garnish with fenugreek leaves (optional).

recipies.description: Experience the freshness of herbs and veggies combined with a subtle drizzle of a refreshing dressing. This vibrant salad adds a splash of beautiful colours on your plate!
ingredients: 1 medium cucumber, peeled and cut into triangles
2 medium onions, cut into quarters and layers separated
1 small green capsicum, cut into triangles
1 small yellow bell pepper, cut into triangles
1 small red bell pepper, cut into triangles
20 gm feta cheese, cut into cubes
recipies.name: Greek Salad with Lemon Dressing
method: Combine lemon juice, oregano, vinegar, garlic, salt, pepper powder, olive oil and parsley in a bowl and mix well.
Mix together cucumber, tomatoes, onions, capsicum, yellow and red bell pepper and olives in a bowl and toss well.
Pour the dressing on top, add lettuce and toss well.
Add feta cheese and mix gently.
Serve chilled.

recipies.description: Time to slow down and enjoy life! A comforting casserole made with bell peppers, capsicum, potatoes, baked beans and sausages.
recipies.name: Sausage and Potato Casserole
method: In a pan, heat some oil.
Add all the vegetables and chopped sausages to it and stir well.
Chop some potatoes and add to the mixture.
Add salt and pepper to taste. Then saute all the vegetables.
Add baked beans, green chilli and parsley to it.
Let it heat for some time and then plate it up.

recipies.description: Light and Lemony!  Lemon flavored rice cooked with curry leaves, ginger, chillies, urad dal, channa dal and served with yogurt made with sizzling tadka of red pepper, urad dal and rai.
recipies.name: Lemon Rice with Spiced Curd
method: Boil the rice, drain and keep aside.
Heat the oil, add
Add the lemon juice, salt, water and simmer for 3 minutes. Add the rice and mix well.
Finally garnish with coriander.
Whisk well, add cucumber and put a tarka of curry leaves, red pepper powder, rai and urad daal.

recipies.description: An easy,vegetarian, Chinese style recipe laden with sam pal oelic and soya sauce which flavors it up!
recipies.name: Stir Fried Tofu with Rice
method: Drizzle refined oil in a preheated pan and add chopped mariner and stir well.
Then add ginger, garlic, shallots and salt & pepper.
Add red chilly paste, soya sauce and honey.
Add some coriander leaves and mix it all together.
Drizzle olive oil in a pre-heated pan and add carrots, spring onions, ginger and salt & pepper.
Then add fresh red chilly, lemon juice and soya sauce and stir all together.
Add some chopped coriander leaves.
Cook it away for 5-7 minutes.
Serve it on a platter.

recipies.description: This is a Thai-inspired salad full of healthy ingredients.
recipies.name: Green Apple Salad
method: Slice the apple in thin slices (similar to match sticks) and put them in a bowl
Add the olives, spring onions and coriander
Season with salt and pepper
Add olive oil and drizzle some honey
Mix well and garnish with spring onions.

recipies.description: A quick and crispy potato snack. This recipe was shared by Tara Deshpande in the gourmet session at The Imperial, New Delhi. The recipe is a part of her book "A Sense for Spice".
recipies.name: Bangbang Batata
method: Scrub and steam the potatoes till they're tender. Cool and peel them.
Take a bowl and mix salt (to taste), sugar, chilli flakes, turmeric powder and semolina together. Coat the potatoes well with this mixture.

Heat the ghee on a pan and saute the green chillies and garlic for 10 seconds. Add the spiced potatoes and cook on low heat for 6-8 minutes. Keep tossing and take off heat when the potatoes have browned and semolina is crisp.
Serve hot with lime wedges.

recipies.description: One of Rocky Singh's favorite Thai dish. Chicken mince tossed in mild oriental flavors with aromatic basil leaves.
recipies.name: Gka Prow Gai (Basil Chicken)
method: Heat oil in pan till very hot.
Add garlic till brown, then onion, chilly paste and sugar.
As soon as onion turns transparent add the mince and cook till almost done.
Add a little water (30 ml) once it starts cooking well
Add the sauces (soy, oyster and fish) and the pepper.
When the mince is done add the basil leaves.
Serve hot.
Cook the mince well before adding the sauces. (do not overcook)
Add the basil leaves right at the end and switch off heat as soon as you do, the leaves will taste better when fresh.
Serve fresh and eat with plain rice.

recipies.description: A quick and easy meal. Spaghetti with some garlic, chillies and olive oil.
recipies.name: Spaghetti Alio Olio Paperoncino
method: Boil the spaghetti in a liter of water with some salt.
Saute the garlic in some extra virgin olive oil.
Add the chilli flakes.
Quickly put in the spaghetti with a little bit of the cooking water.
Just toss once or twice, lightly saute.

recipies.description: An easy to whip up egg and garlic fried rice.
recipies.name: Garlic and Egg Fried Rice
method: In a pan add oil.
Add the egg. Cook for a minute.
Add the ginger, garlic and red chillies.
Add the steamed rice. Toss well.
Add salt, pepper and soya sauce.
Garnish with coriander leaves.
Serve with

recipies.description: This dish comes straight from the joyful state of Rajasthan. Potatoes cooked in mild flavors of nutmeg, coriander, saunf and cumin.
recipies.name: Jaiphali Aloo
method: Slice the potatoes (any shape, here the chef cut it into a starry shape).
Soak them in water for a about 5 minutes.
No boil them in salted water.
Once the water comes to a boil put in the potatoes and let them boil till they are almost cooked.
Be careful not to overcook this too much else the potatoes shall break.
Once done drain them out.
In a pan add the desi ghee and all the masalas. Be careful not to overcook the masalas.
Now add the potatoes to it.
Add a pinch of salt.
Add the finishing spices, white pepper, nutmeg and coriander seed powder.
Give this a quick stir.
Add some coriander leaves and lemon juice.
Mix well and serve hot.

recipies.description: Stir fried beans tossed with some tamarind, jaggery and a spicy coconut mixture. It's easy to make and full of Gujarati flavors. A little sweet, a little tangy!
ingredients: 2 cups french beans, cut 3 cm long
recipies.name: Khatti Meethi Phaliyan
method: Dry roast bedki chillies,  zeera, coriander seeds and coconut.
Pound them together in a mortar and pestle with some salt and water till it makes a fine paste.
Add oil in a pan and stir fry beans on high heat for 2-3 minutes.
In a wok/ kadhai add oil, mustard seeds and til. Saute.
Add the spice paste, curry leaves, turmeric, hing and coriander powder. Saute. Add a little water to help the masala cook.
Add the stir fried beans with tamarind and jaggery. Add a little water to further cook the beans. Cook for 3-4 minutes.
Cover and let it cook in its residual heat.
Serve.

recipies.description: Spaghetti tossed in the tasty blend of cheese, herbs, nuts and garlic of the pesto sauce along with cherry tomatoes and a hint of clove make a fantastic combination. Here's an easy-to-follow recipe!!
ingredients: 250 gm spaghetti, boiled in a pinch of salt and some oilve oil till al dente
1/2 cup toasted walnuts or pine nuts
recipies.name: Spaghetti in Pesto Sauce
method: In a blender add all the ingredients and mix till a semi-fine paste is achieved.
For the Pasta:
In a pan add the olive oil and the garlic clove. Add the cherry tomatoes. Remove the whole garlic clove.
Add the pesto sauce. Cook for 1 minute.
Add the boiled spaghetti.
Garnish with a mint sprig and serve hot.

recipies.description: A healthy breakfast option. This tofu and egg dish is steamed with a hint of soy sauce and red chillies.
ingredients: 1 red chilli, slice diagonally and de-seeded
1 tsp chopped spring onion greens, for garnishing
recipies.name: Steamed Tofu with Egg
method: In a bowl add soya sauce, corn flour, sesame oil, pepper and egg. Whisk it nicely.
In a steaming tin place tofu cubes. Pour over the egg mixture over it.
Add red chiles on top of it and steam for 10 minutes.
Take it out and sprinkle some chopped spring onion greens on it.
Serve hot.

recipies.description: Zeba Kohli whips up a healthy combo of chocolate and muesli.
recipies.name: Choco-Muesli Rocks
method: Mix the chocolate with muesli.
Scoop and divide them into small segments with the help of a spoon and fork onto a flat plate.
Keep them in the freezer to set at 8 C to 12 C for about 20 to 25 minutes
Your Chocolate with Muesli Rocks are ready.

recipies.description: Cherry tomatoes and cream along with Parmesan cheese make for a delicious sauce.
ingredients: 1/2 packet fettuccine, boiled according to packet instructions
recipies.name: Fettuccine in Cherry Tomato Sauce
method: In a pan add olive oil.
Add cherry tomatoes. Saute till they start to blister a little.
Add pepper, garlic, chilli flakes. Mix. Add the cream and mix well.
Add cheese, salt and basil. Saute. Add the boiled pasta.
Mix well. Garnish with some grated Parmesan cheese and basil leaves.
Serve.

recipies.description: With just five ingredients to work with, this flourless chocolate cake is quick and easy to make. Topped with flaked almonds, this cake is a real crowd pleaser!
recipies.name: Flourless Chocolate Cake
method: Break the chocolate into small pieces and melt over hot water.
In a bowl whisk butter and sugar together. As you whisk, add the 4 egg yolks, one at a time.
In another bowl whisk 3 egg whites until frothy.
Let the heated chocolate cool down and pour it into the butter and egg mixture.
Then add the egg white mixture and stir thoroughly.
Pour the chocolate mixture in a floured and buttered oven tray & garnish with flaky almonds.
Set the oven at 175 degrees and bake for about 10 minutes.
Serve the chocolate cake with vanilla ice cream.

recipies.description: Soft and fluffy eggless pancakes with the mild aroma of cinnamon. A perfect Sunday breakfast option.
recipies.name: Cinnamon Pancakes
method: Mix all the dry ingredients in a bowl. Sift it together to make the batter fluffy.
Now add all the wet ingredients to the dry ingredient bowl. Mix. Keep aside for 10 minutes.
On a non-stick pan/ griddle add a little oil and spread the pancake batter. Do not make it too wide. Use about 4 table spoon batter for one pancake.
Once it starts bubbling flip it to the other side. The pancakes should be light golden in color.
Serve the pancakes for breakfast with toppings of your choice: maple syrup, chocolate sauce, cut fruits, butter or a dollop of whipped cream.

recipies.description: Corn, anaar, orange, capsicum with a hint of mint, mustard and tamarind. You'll love the freshness of the chaat.
recipies.name: Corn and Pomegranate Chaat
method: In a bowl, add boiled corn, orange, pomegranate, chopped mint and chopped capsicum. Mix them well together.
Add tamarind extract, salt, mustard sauce, chaat masala, few boondies, chopped coriander leaves, cumin, chili powder and lime.
Mix them all well together and your corn and pomegranate chaat is ready to eat.

recipies.description: Baby corn tossed in a variety of Indian spices. A quick and easy snack.
recipies.name: Baby Corn Masala
method: Heat oil and add cumin, when it splutters, add bay leaf, ginger and the garlic, and saute till a light brown.
Add onions and saute till a golden brown, then add tomatoes and stir fry over medium heat.
When fat separates, add the salt,
Add baby corn and saute till fat separates and serve hot.

recipies.description: Baby corns, onions, peppers and your favorites tossed in a sweet chilly plum sauce.
ingredients: 2 Tbsp cornflour/cornstarch blended with 1 cup water
recipies.name: Vegetables in Plum Sauce
method: Cut the peppers into halves, lengthwise and de-seed and cut off white veins.
Shred into thin strips.
Slice the baby corn into two, lengthwise.
Heat oil in a large pan and add the onions and garlic.
Stir till onions are wet (slightly soft), and add baby corn.
Add the peppers and continue to stir over high heat till they are mixed well.
Add the sauce mixture and bring to a boil.
Simmer till sauce looks smooth and serve hot.

recipies.description: Marinated pearl spot fish wrapped up in a banana leaf and steamed till done. Serve with some steamed rice.
recipies.name: Karimeen Pollichathu
method: Mix red chillies, turmeric powder, chopped green chillies, chopped ginger, chopped garlic, chopped curry leaves, chopped shallots, salt and lime juice to a coarse paste.
After cleaning the fish, apply a thick layer of the paste on the inside and on the outside.
Wrap the fish in the banana leaf and tie it with the stem.
Heat oil in pan and place the wrapped fish in it.
Cook each side for 5-6 minutes.
Serve hot with rice.

recipies.description: Creamy and full of masalas this spicy paneer recipe is a hit with some rice or a crispy butter naan.
recipies.name: Paneer in Spicy Tomato Sauce
method: Blend all the ingredients together except the butter, vegetables and
Heat butter in a frying pan. Fry onions until soft and add capsicum and mushrooms.
Stir and fry for 5 minutes.
Pour in blended sauce ingredients. Bring to a simmer.
Season and stir in the
Allow to heat and serve immediately.

recipies.description: Shitake mushrooms, green chillies and water chestnuts stir fried with celery, leeks and seasoning.
recipies.name: Shitake Fried Rice with Water Chestnuts
method: Slice the shitake mushrooms, green chillies & water chestnuts.
Heat a wok with vegetable oil.
Put onions, celery and leeks.
Add grated ginger, mushrooms and sliced water chestnuts.
Put in the cooked rice, spring onions, few drops soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, garlic and sesame oil.
Stir fry nicely and serve in a bowl.

recipies.description: An easy to cook fish recipe for those who love spicy food.
ingredients: 2 Tbsp corn flour - mixed with water
recipies.name: Spicy Sliced Fish
method: Finely chop red 4-5 red chillies and mince it and add water to make it into a paste.
Add 2 table spoons of oil in a pan on mild heat. Add 2-4 spoons of red chilli paste depending on the amount of spice desired.

Add  around 1 teacup water and saute it. After 30 seconds add  around 300 gms of sliced sole fish. (Remember that the fish is not pre-marinated) Let the water cover the fish and allow it to boil for 3-5 minutes.
Season with salt and sugar. You will know it is done when the sole starts to crumble and the water gets thicker.
After around 3 minutes, add a paste made of cornflour and water
Saute it for a while and take it out in a bowl. Garnish with chopped spring onions before serving.

recipies.description: Spicy fish mixture shaped into cakes and fried, a perfect brunch option!
ingredients: 1 fillet of firm white fish, diced
1 stalk of spring onions, finely chopped
40-50 gm bread crumbs + Bread crumbs to coat the fish cakes
recipies.name: Thai Fish Cakes with Pineapple Chutney
method: In a bowl add diced fish pieces, green beans, spring onions, coriander, lemon juice, lime leaf, fish sauce, lemongrass, Thai curry paste, egg and 40-50 gms of bread crumbs. Mix.
Add this in a food processor or mixie. Take this mixture and shape into balls, flatten into cakes.
Roll in bread crumbs. Shallow fry in hot oil.
Serve with a sweet

recipies.description: Spice up your meal with this chilli gobhi recipe. Cauliflower florets are cooked with an oriental tang. Its quick and easy.
recipies.name: Chilli Gobi
method: Mix together the
Heat the oil, and fry over medium heat to a golden color.
Heat 2 tbsp of the oil in a wok, and stir fry the onions in it over high heat till they look wet.
Add the green chillies and stir a few times, add the remaining salt, soya sauce, vinegar, and the
Mix well, and serve garnished with some greens.
If you like the

recipies.description: Peas and mushrooms rolled up all glossy in yogurt and masalas.
recipies.name: Matar Mushroom Sukhe
method: Heat the clarified butter, add cumin and asafoetida, followed by ginger and saute lightly.
Lower the flame, add 1 tbsp of yoghurt and stir vigorously until well blended.
Continue repeating this, 1-2 tbsp of yoghurt at a time, until it finishes and the oil separates.
Add the
Add green chillies, peas, mushrooms, stir-fry until glossy.
Lower the flame and let cook until the peas become tender.
Serve hot garnished with coriander leaves.

recipies.description: A fiery side - fried chicken cooked with brown, green & white peppercorns and oriental spices.
ingredients: 5-6 dry red chillies - chopped and deseeded
recipies.name: Szechwan Chilli Chicken
method: Flash fry the chicken with ginger till there colour changes to golden.
Now, drain the oil and keep this aside.
Now, add garlic, spring onions green pepper corns and the brown peppercorn.
Stir for 5 minutes and then add the dry chillies, white pepper powder, ajino moto, salt and chilli oil.
Stir again for 5-10 minutes and add the black vinegar.
Stir fry for 10 minutes and garnish with green peppercorns.
Szechwan chilli chicken is ready to eat

recipies.description: French beans, carrots, peas, celery and masalas get stirred effortlessly in big bowl of rice.
recipies.name: Vegetable Fried Rice
method: Boil the rice with 1 tsp salt and 1 Tbsp oil, till 'bite-like'. Drain and rinse under cold water.
Leave in the colander and work 1 Tbsp oil into it.
Heat the rest of the oil and saute the garlic and onions, till onions are a light brown.
Add the beans and cook over low heat, till almost done.
Add the carrots, peas and celery and cook till all vegetables are bite-like.
Add the Soya sauce, vinegar and chilli sauce, mix well and add the rice.
Stir till rice and vegetables are well mixed and serve.

recipies.description: Boneless chunks of chicken coated in refined flour, eggs, light seasoning and deep fried.
ingredients: 250 gm chicken- boneless and cut into small pieces
recipies.name: Chicken Fritters
method: Mix together the chicken, egg, flour, garlic and ginger paste, salt and enough water so as to have a thick batter. Leave it for 5-10 minutes.
Heat the oil and keeping the heat high drop pieces of chicken and fry to a golden brown.
Drain on absorbent paper and serve.

recipies.description: Green beans tossed in the flavors of salt and pepper. Simple and quick. A perfect salad with some potatoes and meat.
ingredients: 200 gm green beans, topped, tailed and cut into 1 cm pieces
recipies.name: Green Bean Salad
method: Boil the beans for 5 minutes. Drain and set aside.
Heat the oil in a wok and add chopped garlic.
Add blanched beans. Fry them for 5 minutes. Add the salt and pepper. Saute.
Serve hot.

recipies.description: Create a lovely platter of lettuce wraps. Lettuce leaves filled with a sumptuous filling of minced chicken, vegetables and tangy plum sauce. Quick, easy and impressive!
recipies.name: Spicy Chicken Lettuce Wrap
method: Take out large lettuce leaves from the bunch and start putting one over the other.
In a pre-heated pan add chilli oil, finely chopped onions and saute for few minutes.
Add ginger garlic chilli paste and minced chicken.
Add soya sauce, black bean sauce and plum sauce. Saute all of them well.
Season it with salt, red chilli flakes and freshly chopped coriander. Drizzle some lemon juice.
Finely chop carrots, cucumbers and radish.
Create a platter with bowls of bean sprouts, plum sauce, radish, carrots, cucumber and spicy minced chicken.
Take a lettuce leaf and put some chicken, add the vegetables and a spoonful of plum sauce. Roll the lettuce leaf, make a wrap and serve.

recipies.description: Blended moong dal cooked with the flavors of coconut milk, cardamom and cinnamon. Moong dal payasam is a great dessert to have on a cold winter evening.
recipies.name: Moong Dal Payasam
method: Soak moong dal in water.
Heat some ghee in a pan and add cinnamon and green cardamom. Saute for a minute.
Drain the dal and add it to the cooking mixture. Add water and cook for sometime. Remove and leave it to cool.
Blend the dal to make a thick puree.
Heat ghee in a pan and add the dal paste, sugar, green cardamom powder, coconut milk and milk. Cook for sometime.
Serve.

recipies.description: Soft, warm cinnamon rolls, now made healthy.
ingredients: 3/4 cup paneer or cottage cheese ( a 5 inch chunk)
1/3 cup low fat buttermilk (lukewarm milk mixed with lemon) it should be curdled.
recipies.name: Cinnamon Rolls
method: Heat the oven to 190 C. Grease the sides and bottom of a round baking pan with butter.
Put the paneer, buttermilk, sugar, melted butter, and vanilla in a food processor and process until smooth, for about 20 seconds.
In another bowl, add the flour, baking powder, salt, baking soda and add this to the mixie.
Start and stop the mixie in short bursts just until the dough clumps together. The dough will be soft and moist.
Dump the dough out and knead it with floured hands 4 or 5 times until smooth.
With a rolling pin, roll the dough into a 12×15-inch rectangle.
Brush the dough with the melted butter, leaving a 1/2-inch border unbuttered around the edges.
In a medium bowl, combine brown sugar, powdered cinnamon and green cardamom powder.
Sprinkle the mixture over the buttered area of the dough and press gently into the surface.
Starting at a long edge, roll up the dough jelly-roll style. Pinch the seam to seal.

With a sharp knife, cut the roll into equal pieces. Place them in a greased pan and bake until golden brown and firm to the touch. Say, about 15 minutes. Set the pan on a wire rack to cool for 5 minutes.
For the glaze, in a small bowl, mix the cream cheese, powdered sugar, and vanilla to make a smooth glaze. Add milk as needed to achieve desired consistency. Spread onto warm rolls.

recipies.description: If you love mangoes then you're going to love this Yum Mamuang, also known as a Raw Mango Salad. All you need is raw mango, onions, chilli, mint, lettuce and sugar make a perfect combination of sweet, spice and sour.
recipies.name: Raw Mango Salad
method: Peel the raw mangoes and grate them. Then, slice the onions.
Toss the rest of the ingredients together with the raw mangoes and onions.
Add crushed peanuts and serve it on a bed of lettuce.

recipies.description: The classic mayo dip is enhanced with tangy tomato puree, garlic and fresh herbs. Use it as a sandwich spread or for a dip with salads.
ingredients: 1 Tbsp chopped garden herbs (basil, thyme and parlsey)
recipies.name: Tomato Mayonnaise
method: In a bowl take some mayonnaise.
Then add a Tbsp of cream and tomato puree.
Add garlic paste and freshly chopped herbs.
Combine all the ingredients and mix it well.
Use it as a dip, sandwich spread or serve with appetizers.

recipies.description: Malpua is a pancake like Indian dessert, fried in ghee and dipped in sugar syrup.
recipies.name: Malpua
method: Make a smooth batter with the listed ingredients.
Mix in the sugar, water, lemon juice and make the sugar syrup, add saffron.
Heat the
Pour the equivalent of 3 tablespoons of batter into the
Strain and soak the

recipies.description: This fusion of Mughlai seekh kebab and Italian pizza is sure to tantalize your taste buds.
recipies.name: Kebab and Paneer Pizza
method: Heat oil, add herbs, salt and pepper, tomato, tomato puree & cook until the oil separates. Keep aside. Put tomato sauce mixture on the pizza base & grate the cheese.
For topping up:
Cut cooked
Cut
Arrange onion rings, pickled green chillies and sprinkle with salt.
Bake in oven until cheese melts and base edges get brown.

recipies.description: Three types of mushrooms cooked together with garlic, sherry, truffle oil and one of the most important ingredients, butter. They go perfectly on well toasted bread and make a great appetizer or even main course if you're in the mood for something different.
ingredients: 100 gms dried porcini mushrooms, soaked and chopped
40 gms dried morels, soaked and chopped
4 pieces of bread, sliced in half
recipies.name: Gousse d' Ail (Mushroom on Toast)
method: Heat the oil in a large saucepan. Add the chopped onions, garlic and saute for a few minutes.
Add the mushrooms and toss gently. Cook the mushrooms until tender, for about 8 minutes.
Add the sherry, parsley, salt, and pepper. Cook for another 5 minutes, or until mushrooms are soft and finish with butter and truffle oil.
Check for seasoning and serve hot with toasted white bread on top.

recipies.description: Refined flour mixed with yeast and baked.
ingredients: egg yolk beaten mixed with a little milk to glaze
recipies.name: Paav
method: Dissolve sugar in 1/2 cup lukewarm water and sprinkle yeast over it.
Leave in draught-free place to froth (about 10 minutes).
Mix the salt and oil into the flour and knead it to a smooth soft dough, using lukewarm water.
Place in a bowl and cover with cling film and leave in a draught-free place to rise.
When it rises (at least doubles), knock down and leave again to rise.
After second rising, knead a little more and shape into 4-6 rounds.
Grease a square tin which will take in all the rolls placed about 1" apart--when they rise, the rolls should be touching each other, so you can get those dents.
Cover again and leave to rise, after brushing them with the egg yolk mixture.
After 15-20 minutes, bake in a pre-heated oven for 15-20 minutes.

recipies.description: Jalebi is a melt-in-the-mouth Indian sweet and can best be described as funnel cakes. Create culinary magic in your kitchen with this delectable delicacy.
ingredients: A square piece of cloth with a hole in it, or a strong plastic bag for piping out the 'jalebis'
recipies.name: Kesari Jalebi
method: Mix the flour and dahi to form a thick smooth paste (dropping consistency), adding water if necessary and leave to ferment for 6-7 hours (time depending on the weather).
When the batter is ready, it should be spongy and you should be able to see bubbles on the surface.
Make the sugar syrup by dissolving sugar and saffron in the water over low heat, then cook over high heat till slightly thick.

When this mixture is lifted with a spoon and poured back into the pan, it should fall in a thin smooth stream, or when a drop of it is cooled a little, press it between your thumb and forefinger and then pull the fingers apart, it should be thread-like. Keep warm, till you fry the 'jalebis'.

Take a shallow, heavy pan and heat the ghee/oil. To test if your oil is ready, drop in little bit of batter in the oil, and see if it comes up at once. If it does, your oil is ready for frying. Fill the bag with the batter. Twist the opening to seal the bag. Snip one lower corner of the bag to make a small hole, through which you can pipe out the `jalebis'. The smaller the hole, the thinner the jalebis.

Hold the bag over the hot oil and pipe out swirls (like whirlpools), of the desired size, straight into it. Make as many such rounds as come in comfortably without touching each other. Lower the heat to medium and turn the 'jalebis' over and fry till a light brown on both sides.
Lift out the fried jalebis, drain out the oil and put them into the syrup. Leave it for a minute or so, and then again lift it out.
Serve it hot.

recipies.description: An Eid-special sweet treat made with vermicelli, nutmeg, nuts and ghee.
recipies.name: Parsi Sev
method: Heat the ghee in a large kadahi or deep sauce pan and fry the raisins, charoli and almonds, separately and keep aside.
In the remaindered ghee add the vermicelli and saute till an aroma emanates and it gets slightly darker.
In the meantime, put the sugar, water, nutmeg and cardamom in another pan, over medium heat, stirring off and on till the sugar dissolves and bring to a boil.
When the vermicelli is roasted add the sugar syrup and the vanilla and bring to a boil, cover and let cook over low heat till the liquid is absorbed and the sevian are cooked through.
The vermicelli strands should be cooked and separate like rice in a pulao.
Serve hot garnished with the raisins, charoli and almonds.

recipies.description: Whip up a bowlful of this comforting raita with onions, cumin, chillies and coriander to enhance the flavour.
ingredients: Garnish chilli powder roasted cumin crushed
recipies.name: Pyaaz ka Raita
method: Whisk the yoghurt along with the cream and salt.
Mix in the cumin powder, sliced onions, chopped green chillies and coriander leaves.
Serve garnished with cumin and chilli powder.

recipies.description: Pita bread served with three cool and refreshing dips: beetroot, yogurt and carrot. This middle eastern food is a light and healthy option for you.
recipies.name: Pita Bread with Dips
method: Blend the boiled beetroots into a fine paste.
To the beetroot paste add curd, grated garlic, lemon juice, olive oil and mix them all together.
Drizzle some olive oil and garnish with olives and chopped mint.
Season to taste.
In a salad bowl, take yogurt, lemon juice, olive oil, mint, parsley, salt, pepper and cumin powder.
Mix all the ingredients together to make the labneh.
Heat butter in a pan; add some olive oil and grated carrots.
In a flat plate, take yogurt, add garlic, salt, pepper and olive oil then add cooked carrots to the yogurt mix.
Top with chopped parsley and olive oil.
Serve Pita bread with the three refreshing dips.

recipies.description: Winner of the weekly Guilt Free Contest bakes away decadent chocolate brownies with healthy ingredients like curd, olive oil, wheat flour, honey and nuts.
recipies.name: Low Fat Chocolate Brownies
method: Whisk curd till no lumps are formed, add almonds.
Add honey, oil. Whisk again.
Then sieve flour and chocolate powder 2 times.
Line the cake tin with butter paper and oil it.
In the cake batter add cream, baking powder and soda.
Fold in the flour and walnuts. (Do not beat too much)
Pour the mixture in a cake tin.
Cover with aluminum foil and place the cake in a preheated oven at 170 degrees for 30 minutes.
Uncover and bake again for 10 minutes till its done. Decorate as per your choice.

recipies.description: These beetroot and tofu kebabs are a power house of energy. Brimming with antioxidants these kebabs hardly have any calories.
ingredients: 1/4 cup chopped cashew nuts, to stuff
recipies.name: Beetroot Kebab
method: Take a bowl and put the grated beetroot, the tofu followed by garlic,
Mince with your hands & make round patties and insert the chopped cashews as a filling. Make round kebabs.
Coat the patties with crushed oat powder.
In a flat pan heat the oil and lightly fry these.
Served with a dollop of green chutney.

recipies.description: Italian Risotto made the healthy way with quinoa. It is a grain-like crop which is gluten-free, rich in fiber and full of protein.
ingredients: Sea salt and freshly ground pepper
recipies.name: Quinoa Risotto
method: Rinse the quinoa in water a few times.
Soak the porcini mushrooms in warm water for half and hour.
Take olive oil in a pan, saute the onion and the garlic together. Do this on a low flame and don't brown the garlic.
When the onions look glossy, bung in the mushrooms, and add a cup of wine.
Let the quinoa soak it all up.
Add salt.
Then take a couple of ladles of chicken stock to the quinoa. When it disappears, add some more, till you see the quinoa white and shiny, and cooked.
While it's hot, lavish some freshly ground black pepper.
Finally toss some grated parmesan cheese, give it a stir and serve hot.

recipies.description: A healthy salad with the goodness of beetroots, red chowli beans, spring onions, asparagus and a lot more, drizzled with a tangy beet-orange dressing.
ingredients: 60 gm ripe mango, cubed or sliced
30 gm raw mango, cut into long strips
recipies.name: Roasted Beet and Red Chowli Salad with Upbeat Vinaigrette
method: Season the beetroot with salt, pepper and olive oil.
Wrap in
Trim the beetroot by taking out the skin and cut these into cubes.
Leave the trimmings aside for later use.
Transfer the beetroot into a bowl and add the cooked red chowli, ripe mango, raw mango and tomato.
In a blender, add all the leftover beetroot trimmings, orange zest, orange juice, a big pinch of salt and pepper, olive oil and mix well.
In a tray season the spring onions with salt, pepper and 1 tsp of olive oil.
Lightly grill these on a till a little black and soft.
Crumble the feta cheese in a small bowl.
Season it with zataar spice.
Pour the dressing over the beetroot and chowli salad and mix well.
Transfer the salad onto a plate, garnish with spring onions, grilled asparagus and the crumbled zataar spiced feta.

recipies.description: Fish marinated with yogurt and an assortment of masalas. Grilled till golden and crisp.
recipies.name: Tandoori Pomfret
method: In a bowl, take yoghurt, mustard paste, red chilli powder, turmeric, salt, mustard oil, lemon juice and mix well.
Cut slits into the fish.
Marinate the fish with the paste.
Grill the fish till it is crispy and golden brown.
Serve on a platter with lettuce and lemon wedges.

recipies.description: The inspiration for this recipe comes from la petit maison.
ingredients: 1/2 apple, granny smith, cut into 1-2mm cubes
A few cherry tomatoes halved and slightly crushed
recipies.name: Lentil Salad
method: Put the lentils in a saucepan and cover with 450 ml water. Add the garlic clove and 1/2 of the onion.
Bring to boil and cover with a lid. Let simmer for 20-25 min until the lentils are cooked but still have a slight bite to them. You do not want to end up with a lentil mush.

Prepare the celery and apple now. Finely chop the other half of the onion too. Once you have chopped the apple, put it in a bowl with water and lemon juice, otherwise the apple will start turning brown.
Drain the lentils and cool down under cold, running water.
Put them in a bowl, add the apples, tomatoes, onion, celery and chopped mint. Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice to taste. Season with salt and pepper.

recipies.description: Almonds, poppy seeds and cardamom makes for enhanced frothy milk. Nutritious and tasty. Almond milk is a great substitute for cow's milk, for people who are lactose intolerant or follow a vegan diet.
recipies.name: Vegan Almond Milk
method: Soak almonds for about three hours.
Place almonds in a small pan and add boiling water to the pan.
Keep aside for five minutes and drain the water.
Soak poppy seeds for two hours.
Peel almonds and grind them with poppy seeds into a fine paste.
Add the paste to cold soya milk and strain through a muslin cloth. Discard the residue.
Add sugar and cardamom powder to the strained soy milk.
Blend till frothy and serve warm or chilled.

recipies.description: The freshness of yogurt infused with sweet pomegranate juice and ruby red seeds with a pinch of red chilly to balance the flavors.
ingredients: A pinch of red chilli powder
recipies.name: Anardana Raita
method: Whisk the yogurt to make it nice and creamy.
Add a pinch of salt and some red chilli powder.
Add the pomegranate juice and the seeds to yogurt mix.
One can make pomegranate juice at home by blending the seeds and strain out the juice.
Keep stirring the paste until it gets a pinkish color.
If the yogurt gets a little thin, tie it in a muslin cloth to drain the water and replace it with a pomegranate juice.
Serve it with any rice dish.

recipies.description: Small rounds of dough deep fried. Tastes best with aloo gravy!
recipies.name: Puri
method: Rub the `ghee' into the flour, add salt and knead into a stiffish dough with the water.
Cover the dough and leave to rest, for at least 30 minutes.
Roll out the
Heat the oil and when a piece of dough comes up at once, put the
It will come up at once, press gently with a slotted spoon in the center, so that it puffs up.
Turn it over and fry till a light brown on both sides.
Remove from the fat, and place on an absorbent paper, before transferring on to a serving dish.

recipies.description: Dough stuffed with a yummy dal mixture. Deep fried till golden and puffy. Serve with aloo ki sabzi.
recipies.name: Pithi Puri
method: Mix flour semolina and water together to make a dough. The dough is ready.
Soak black gram
Now grind the
Mix well.
Make a palm sized ball from the dough.
Flatten it and add a small piece of
Now enclose the
Roll and deep fry.
Serve hot with

recipies.description: Despite what the name suggests, Bombay Duck is actually a kind of fish native to the waters between Mumbai and Kutch. And yes, you can pickle that too.
ingredients: 1 bunch curry leaves- clean and remove stems
1 ginger, chopped in pieces of 1 inch each
3-4 sprigs curry leaves, clean and remove stems
recipies.name: Bombay Duck Pickle
method: Wash the Bombay Ducks in vinegar and drain well.
Grind the chillis, garlic, ginger, salt and turmeric to a paste.
Heat the oil and fry the fish over high heat till brown.
Drain it off the oil and keep it aside.
Fry the curry leaves in the same oil, until they turn dark brown.
Take them out of the oil and keep aside.
In the remaining oil, add the ground paste and stir fry till the fat separates.
Add the fried Bombay Ducks and cook them for 15 minutes over slow fire.
Finally add the fried curry leaves mix well and shut off the heat. Store in an airtight jar.

recipies.description: A delicate pudding of bread, milk, raisins and marmalade.
recipies.name: Bread Pudding
method: Break two eggs in a bowl.
Whisk them till they are nice and fluffy.
Add the sugar.
Add essence and milk.
Mix well.
Sprinkle some raisins
Line a steaming dish with bread slices cut in cubes.
Pour the mixture over the bread.
Glaze it with some marmalade.
Now put the plate onto a steamer and place it in boiling water for about 10 minutes.
Alternatively you can bake it also bake it for 5-7 minutes.

recipies.description: A refreshing way to beat the heat. Throw in some watermelon pieces along with ginger, lemon, orange juice and lots of ice!
recipies.name: Watermelon, Mint, Lime & Ginger Slushie (My Yellow Table)
method: Remove watermelon seeds
Cut it into dices,
Grind together mint leaves, chopped ginger, sugar, crushed ice & diced watermelon in a juicer.
Serve.

recipies.description: Dark rum blended with hot apple juice and cinnamon. Perfect to snug with on a cold evening.
recipies.name: Utterly Simple
method: Rim glass with cinnamon sugar.
Put rum in the glass.
Break and add the cinnamon stick.
Top it up with steaming apple juice.
Float the apple slice.

recipies.description: An easy to make, delicious mango drink that will please one and all. Sip on the ecstatic taste of mango nectar coupled with lemon juice and sugar.
ingredients: Mango juice (mango pulp, strained through a fine sieve)
recipies.name: Mango Squash
method: Add together sugar, lemon juice and mango juice in a pan.
Cover the pan and place it under the sun for a few days.
Ensure giving it a stir at least 3-4 times a day.
When dissolved, store in clean bottles.
Add 4 cups sugar and 2 cups water in a pan.
Bring to a boil.
Make sure that the contents are dissolved completely.
Cook over high heat or till one-thread consistency is reached.
Take it off the heat and mix in the lemon and mango juice.
Store in sterilized air tight bottles.

recipies.description: A fun, fruity cocktail that is a hit with girls and also the easiest way to impress. Give it a go!
ingredients: Garnish: Half a slice orange/sparked orange peel.
recipies.name: Cosmopolitan
method: Fill the shaker 3/4 with ice.
Add all the ingredients, squeeze both wedges of lime and drop in.
Shake it and strain into a martini glass.
Take a small peel of orange, flame it to extract the oil essence, drop it in the drink.

recipies.description: Experience a new high with this citrus drink. Bursting with the freshness of orange and intoxicating vodka, get the party started!
recipies.name: Orange Liquer
method: Wash the fruit well and wipe dry.
Prick with a needle in two places and place them in a clean jar.
Fill 1/4 of the jar with it.
Now cover with a thick layer of sugar and mix well.
Cover again with a layer of sugar and then fill the jar with vodka.
Keep for about 2 months.
Stir everyday till the sugar dissolves.
Drain through a thin cloth and store.

recipies.description: A super nourishing drink bursting with fragrant flavours of almonds, cardamoms and kewda.
ingredients: 8 green cardamoms -crushed, cooked in water and strained
recipies.name: Badaam ka Sharbat
method: Add a little water (enough to facilitate blending) to the almonds and blend to a fine paste.
Strain through a fine sieve or muslin cloth and add some more water to the left-over almonds and blend and strain again.
Make the liquid up-to 2 cups, by adding water if necessary.
Add sugar to the strained almond liquid and dissolve over low heat.
When it dissolves, increase the heat and bring to a boil and let the syrup cook.
Keep skimming off the scum as it cooks.
Cook till a drop of syrup pressed between two fingers, forms a thread (one-thread consistency).
Add the cardamom extract and the kewda essence. Strain through a muslin cloth and cool.
When cool, mix the potassium in a little of the syrup first and then add to the whole lot.
Store in clean airtight bottles.

recipies.description: Shaken white rum and cherry liqueur garnished with pink grapefruit foam and cherry.
recipies.name: Hemmingway Air
method: Add all ingredients into shaker with ice.
Shake and strain into glass.
Squirt the grapefruit foam over drink.
Garnish.

recipies.description: The classic martini with vodka and scotch.
recipies.name: Classic Dry Martini
method: Fill martini glass with ice and keep to chill.
Add plenty of ice in the cocktail shaker and pour in the chilled vodka.
Dip a stirrer into a bottle of scotch and stir the vodka and ice with the scotch lined stirrer.
Strain into the chilled glass.
Stick in the olive stick.

recipies.description: A hot milk beverage flavored with saffron and cardamom.
recipies.name: Kesaria Doodh
method: Put milk in a pan and bring to a boil.
Simmer over low heat, stirring a few times till it thickens (about 1/3 should be evaporated, at least).
Add sugar, saffron and cardamom powder.
Stir till the sugar is dissolved and simmer for about 5 min.
Serve hot garnished with green cardamoms, pistachios and almonds.

recipies.description: Granita made from watermelon and melon juice, semi frozen and delicious.
ingredients: Dry ice crushed as much required
Few sprigs of mint to garnish
recipies.name: Watermelon And Musk Melon Granita
method: Put one teaspoon of sugar substitute in each juice.
Whisk the juice with the dry ice, while putting spoonfuls of dry ice one spoon at a time.
Until it resembles a sorbet or until the juice thickens and is a frozen sludge.
Put in a martini glass and garnish with mint leaves.
Alternatively, freeze the juice mix and blend to get the right consistency.

recipies.description: A new take on the good old lassi. Creamy yogurt and pulpy mango mixed in with loads of ice.
recipies.name: Mango Lassi
method: Whip all the ingredients together in a blender.
Serve chilled.

recipies.description: For all the coffee lovers, a scrumptious cooler made with the flavors of strong black coffee, cream and chocolate ice cream. Heavenly!
recipies.name: Mocha Cooler
method: Dissolve the chocolate in hot coffee. Pour in milk. Chill.
Whisk in cream. Pour over ice cream in the glasses.
Serve immediately.

recipies.description: All it takes is five minutes and three ingredients to whip up this cold and delicious smoothie. Have it for breakfast or in the evening when hunger starts to kick in and it'll leave you feeling happy and full.
recipies.name: Apple Chia Seeds Smoothie
method: Put all the ingredients in a blender and blend well.
Serve chilled.

recipies.description: Bread pieces doused in onions, tomatoes, chillies and yogurt with a hint of fresh lemon. This tarka bread snack recipe is quick and easy to make.
recipies.name: Tadka Bread Snack
method: Heat the oil in a small saucepan, then add the mustard seeds. Once they have popped, tip in the onion and chillies and stir for a minute.
Then add the turmeric, sugar, cumin and salt and continue to fry for 1 minute. Pour in the yogurt and lemon juice, stirring continuously.
Lastly, fold in the bread carefully so that it doesn't crumble too much.
Cook for 2 more minutes, then serve sprinkled with coriander and chopped tomato.
Dollop some extra yogurt over the finished dish to cool it.

recipies.description: A perfect dessert to be served on festivals, this Kesaria Mishri Mawa is a rich combination of Saffron milk and ghee which shall leave a mark on your taste bud.
recipies.name: Kesaria Mishri Mava
method: Heat milk in a heavy bottom pan. Stir it continuously so that it does not stick to pan.
Reduce the milk until it starts to thicken.
Add
Cook for 5 more minutes on medium heat.
When it cools down a little add
Pour the mix into shot glasses, chill them in the fridge and serve them.

recipies.description: Easy to make banana pancakes topped with golden caramelized apples.
recipies.name: Banana Pancakes With Caramelized Apples
method: In a pan add apples, salt, sugar and butter.
Add 1 tsp of lemon juice. Cook over low heat.
Stir occasionally until the apples are soft and done.
Mash bananas with a fork.
Add sugar, salt and baking powder in both the flours. Mix in both the flours.
Stir the milk to a pancake consistency.
Pour 1 tsp butter in a non-stick pan.
Pour a ladle of pancake mixture into the pan.
Cook over medium heat till brown. Flip the pancake to cook both the sides.
Serve with caramelized apples.

recipies.description: These holiday cookies are perfect to keep yourselves and your kids entertained in the kitchen. Freshly baked chocolate cookies crowned with a festive coconut-flavored topping.
ingredients: 3 Tbsp or 45 ml of canola oil
2 tsp or 10 ml of vanilla of extract
recipies.name: Snow-Capped Fudge Cookies
method: Preheat oven to 375 °F (190 °C).
In a large mixing bowl, combine 1 1/2 cups (375 mL) sugar, canola oil, milk, vanilla and melted chocolate.
In a small mixing bowl, set aside one egg white. Add yolk and remaining eggs to chocolate mixture. Beat well.
Sift together flour and baking powder and add to chocolate mixture. Mix well.
Cover and chill for 1 hour, or until dough is easy to handle.
Clean beaters and beat reserved egg white with electric mixer set on medium speed, until soft peaks form.
Gradually add 2 Tbsp (30 mL) sugar, beating on high speed until stiff peaks form. Fold in coconut.
Shape dough into 1inch (2.5cm) balls. Place 2 inches (5 cm) apart on cookie sheet. Flatten slightly with your fingers.
Top each flattened ball of dough with 1/2 tsp (2 mL) of coconut mixture.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until tops are lightly browned. Remove and cool on wire rack.

recipies.description: Dough parcels filled with fresh veggies, dhania powder, amchoor and baked crisp.
ingredients: 1 kg mixed vegetables-chopped fine, and cooked
1 tsp chilli powder or to taste
egg yolk-mixed with 2 Tbsp milk for brushing or just milk
recipies.name: Vegetable Patties
method: Mix maida, salt and 1 cup butter into a crumbly consistency.
2. Add 1 the water and continue to mix into a crumbly mixture. Add some more water till no dry particles remain.
Cover in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour or so.
Beat the butter into a 6" square between two sheets of plastic.
Roll the dough into a rectangle 12"x 26".
Place butter in center and fold first one end over, then the other.
Press edges to seal and refrigerate for 15 minutes.
Roll dough into a long strip again, fold one third from one end towards center and then the other. Chill. And repeat twice more before using as required.
Heat butter and add onions when butter melts.
Saute till onions are a little soft.  Add vegetables, salt, dhania, garam masala, amchoor, chilli powder and pissi kali mirch and stir-fry till well mixed.
Roll dough 1" thick, cut into rectangles.
Wet edges, place the mixture in one half and fold over. Press to seal.
Brush top with egg yolk mixture and bake in a hot oven 425 F-200C for 15 to 20 minutes.

recipies.description: Who doesn't love marshmallows? Make this childhood favorite at home! Marshmallows are confections made with gelatine, corn syrup and sugar.
recipies.name: Marshmallows
method: Sprinkle gelatine over a cup of water.
Sprinkle half the Icing sugar mixture over the greased tray.
Grease a deep saucepan and add the sugar, corn syrup and water in it. Cook over low heat, stirring till sugar dissolves. Cover and bring to a boil.
Uncover and cook without stirring, till it reaches a hard ball consistency--drop a little syrup into cold water and it should firm up immediately.
Take off the heat and pour over gelatine, beating all the time with a beater, till fluffy and light. Add vanilla and pour mixture into prepared tray. Refrigerate over night.
Sprinkle rest of icing sugar mixture over, turn over on to a board and cut into cubes.
Dry for 2-3 hours and store.

recipies.description: Winner of the weekly Guilt Free Contest whips up an easy to make banana oat bread made with whole wheat and oat flour. Butter has been replaced with olive oil and refined sugar with dark brown sugar.
ingredients: 1/3 cup extra light virgin olive oil
recipies.name: Banana Oat Bread
method: Pre-heat oven to 180 degrees Celsius.
Combine all dry ingredients in a bowl (Whole wheat flour, oatmeal, baking powder, baking soda, salt,sugar).
Combine all wet ingredients in a bowl (Mashed ripe bananas, Egg, vanilla essence, olive oil).
Fold in dry ingredients into the wet ingredients.
Lightly oil a baking tin with olive oil.
Add the banana bread batter into the baking tin. Sprinkle nuts of choice. (I used roughly chopped walnuts).
Place the baking tin in the oven and let it bake for about 50-55 mins or until a pierced toothpick comes out clean.
Serve warm or cold.

recipies.description: Stuff you sandwich breads with these thyme and dill tossed roasted potatoes.
recipies.name: Roasted Herbed Potatoes
method: Preheat oven to 475 degrees F (245 degrees C).
In a large bowl, combine oil, garlic, basil, marjoram, dill weed, thyme, oregano, parsley, red pepper flakes, and salt.
Stir in potatoes until evenly coated. Place potatoes in a single layer on a roasting pan or baking sheet.
Roast for 20 to 30 minutes in the preheated oven, turning occasionally to brown on all sides.
Fill the filings in the sandwich, loaded with veggies, sprinkle some cheese and enjoy.

recipies.description: A sinful chocolate cupcake topped with a chocolatey frosting. An absolute delight for all the chocolate fans!
recipies.name: Mud Chocolate Cupcake with Choc Ganache Frosting
method: Preheat your oven to 325° F (160° C) and prepare 12 paper cupcake cases in muffin tins.
Place the butter and chocolate into a double boiler and stir until melted, then set aside.
In another bowl beat the sugar and eggs with a mixer on slow until thick and well blended, then fold in the flour and baking powder.
Slowly add the chocolate and butter mixture and mix until well combined.
Then spoon batter into cases until they are half full and then place in the middle rack in your pre-heated oven.
Bake for approximately 20 to 22 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Then remove and let sit for a few minutes before removing the cupcakes from the tins and placing them on a wire rack to cool.
Chop the chocolate and place it in a bowl, then heat the cream in a saucepan over medium heat until it just starts to boil.
Pour the cream over the chocolate and let the chocolate melt for a minute, then mix until glossy & smooth.
Cover each cool cupcake with a layer of ganache and refrigerate the rest of the ganache until it is thick enough to hold its shape.
Fill a piping bag with the remaining ganache and pipe a large rosette in the center of each cupcake.
Refrigerate cupcakes until the ganache has set.
When the cupcakes have cooled, use an apple corer and make a well in the centre and fill it with the frosting too. It results in very nice and chocolatey liquid centre.

recipies.description: Avakkai is a type of Andhra pickle. Along with a mix of spices, this recipe also used black channas.
recipies.name: Avakkai
method: Choose solid,firm and good variety mangoes.Wash,pat dry and cut in to cubes as shown.
Take mustard in a blender and powder nicely.
Place cut mangoes in a clean vessel.Add red chilli powder,turmeric powder, fenugreek powder, asafoetida, mustard powder and salt.
Add sesame oil and black channa.
Mix well. Keep it covered in a clean jar and use after a week.
The peculiarity of this pickle is addition of black channa and it gives a good aroma to the pickle, so don't avoid it.
Adding red chilli powder is up to you, you may reduce it if you want.
Do mix the jar daily once and keep it in sun light with a cloth tied to the jar. This increases the shelf live of the pickle.

recipies.description: A soft and creamy mousse with juicy strawberries, puree and whipped cream.
ingredients: 1 1/4 Tbsp gelatine soaked in 7 Tbsp water
recipies.name: Strawberry Mousse
method: Place strawberries in a pan and add sugar.
Cook on slow flame until juice runs. Thicken with cornflour mixed with rum or water.
Pour into serving dish and cool. Whip whites until stiff.
Gradually whisk in sugar. Stir in strawberry puree, followed by gelatine that has been dissolved over gentle heat.
Fold in whipped cream. Bring to setting point and pour over strawberries.
Chill well before serving.

recipies.description: Porridge with a twist. Soaked basil seeds are teamed with coconut milk with yummy berries atop.
recipies.name: Basil Seeds & Coconut Porridge
method: Soak basil seeds in coconut milk & keep aside for 30 minutes.
Once they have bloomed, pour into a bowl, garnish with chopped or diced mango,

recipies.description: A buttery shortcake with fresh fruits and whipped cream. Perfect for tea time and a treat for the kids.
recipies.name: Fresh Fruit Shortcake
method: Sift the flour onto a cool surface into a ring.
Place butter, yolks, sugar and vanilla in center. Work into a smooth paste.
Draw in flour and knead lightly into smooth dough. Chill for about 10 minutes.
Roll out to a 9" round, 1/4 " thick. With a fork poke all over.
Bake at 180 degrees C 15- 20 minutes or till golden in color.
When cool, brush with glaze, cover with fruit and finish with cream.
You can also cut the cake into half and fill with the fruits in between.

recipies.description: Succulent lamb burgers with the crunchiness of cashew nuts and the creaminess of peanut butter. Smothered with satay sauce containing sweet chilli sauce, penaut butter and coconut cream.
recipies.name: Lamb Satay Burger
method: For the burgers, deseed and quarter the peppers.
Grill until the skin blackens. Peel away skin and chop the peppers.
Combine with remaining burger ingredients. Blend and shape into patties.
Chill for 30 minutes.
Shallow fry in hot oil until cooked through.
Combine the ingredients in a pan.
Bring to a simmer while whisking until thickened.
Stir in coriander.
Season and serve with the burgers.

recipies.description: Scrumptious chicken served in a lettuce cup/on tortilla chips with salsa dip.
ingredients: 1/2 kg chicken boneless, cut into juliennes.
recipies.name: Guilt Free Chicken Tacos
method: Marinate chicken in garlic, lemon juice and taco seasoning for a few hours. Then take a pan and in one tablespoon of oil, fry the chicken till its cooked.
Now instead of a taco, place the chicken in a lettuce cup, wrap and roll.
Top with salsa, and dip.
Alternatively, place this chicken on tortilla chips and serve.
Take a crisp lettuce cup, put the cooked chicken in it first. Then add a dollop of salsa followed by a dollop of Mexican yoghurt dip. Don't put the dip first, it will make the lettuce soggy.
If you don't want to eat lettuce, you can put the cooked taco chicken on tortilla chips, and add a touch of dip and salsa and serve as finger food.
If you buy a ready made tortilla packet from the market, do not reheat them on high heat, they will turn brittle if you overcook them. Just cook them on low heat.

recipies.description: Made with crunchy oreo cookies, luscious cream cheese and melted chocolate, this cake is a sweet sweet blessing.
recipies.name: Oreo Cookie Cheesecake
method: Crush about 20 cookies and and mix in the melted butter. Line the base of the baking pan evenly with this mixture.
Now beat cream cheese, sugar and cornflour together. Once it becomes creamy, mix in the eggs but do it one at a time.
Stir in the liquor and vanilla essence. Add melted chocolate and cream. Break the remaining cookies into smaller pieces and mix.
Pour the batter over the crust and bake it in the oven at 180 degrees C for about 10 minutes. Turn the heat down to 100 degrees C and bake for 2 hours.
When done leave the cake in the oven to cool for two hours and then refrigerate overnight.
Garnish with some mint leaves. Slice and serve.

recipies.description: Tex Mex Chicken Enchiladas Recipe. Rolled tortillas stuffed with creamy, cheesy chicken filling, drizzled with a tangy tomato sauce and baked golden.
recipies.name: Chicken Enchiladas
method: Brush the tortillas with butter on both sides.
In center of each tortilla, pile about 1/4 cup of the diced chicken, one or two tbsp of the ripe olives, a tsp of chopped onion and a sprinkling of shredded cheese.
Roll up and place filled tortillas side by side in a buttered baking dish, 11x7-inch or 9-inch square.
Heat oil in a saucepan, saute the garlic in it.
Add tomato puree, water, salt and chilli powder.
Pour the sauce over the rolls and sprinkle 2 Tbsp of chopped onion and 1/4 cup shredded cheese.
Bake at 350 degrees for about 15 to 20 minutes. Serve hot.

recipies.description: Cupcakes filled with sugar, fruit and topped with whipped cream and mint sprigs.
recipies.name: Fruit Cupcakes
method: Cream butter, sugar and rind together.
Gradually pour in beaten eggs.
Fold in flour and baking powder.
Spoon into oiled muffin moulds/paper cases.
Bake at 180 degrees centigrade for 10-15 minutes. Cool.
Scoop out the center from the cupcakes.
Combine filling ingredients and place a 1 tsp in each of the cake hollows.
Top with whipped cream and mint sprigs.

recipies.description: A top favorite munch, oven toasted multi-grain bread lathered with a garlic and butter.
recipies.name: Multi-Grain Garlic Bread
method: Pre-heat the pan.
Chop 5 garlic cloves.
Cut 3-4 thick slices of multi-grain bread.
Add 4 Tbsp of butter into the hot pan.
Add chopped garlic and 1 tsp chili flakes. Mix well.
Turn off the heat and let it cool down. Transfer to a bowl.
Spread the garlic butter on the bread slices and put in the oven at 150 degrees for 2 to 3 minutes till the bread turns golden brown.

recipies.description: This incredibly easy pasta salad recipe will get you hooked. Tip in some fresh herbs like parsley and basil for some added flavour, or a dollop of cream for some indulgence.
ingredients: 1 cup broccoli, cut into small pieces
recipies.name: Broccoli, Babycorn and Colourful Pasta Salad
method: Blanch the broccoli in a pan of hot water for 7-8 minutes, and drain well.
Boil the penne until al dante. Run under cold water and drain well.
Heat olive oil in a pan, add garlic and saute for 1-2 minutes. Add the babycorn and saute until slightly brown.
Add the broccoli and toss well for 1-2 minutes. Add seasoning and remove from the flame.
Toss in the pasta, and finish with a shaving of Parmesan on top.

recipies.description: A quick and easy dessert to curb your sweet cravings. Dates impart natural sweetness to the kheer and nuts add a nice crunch.
recipies.name: Dates and Walnut Kheer
method: In a non-stick pan add dates and water and cook on a low flame till the dates turn soft. Allow the dates to cool. Then using a blender make a fine paste adding 100 ml milk to the mixture.
Heat the remaining milk in another pan and cook it on low flame. Add sugar and the date paste and mix well.
Add oats and half the quantity of crushed walnut and almond, bring to a boil.
Cool the mixture and refrigerate it. While serving steer in the cream and garnish with remaining nuts.

recipies.description: A rich Punjabi dessert made with flour, milk, loads of nuts and desi ghee, perfect for festive celebrations
recipies.name: Atte Ki Pinni
method: In a heavy bottom pan or kadhai, heat ghee and add the wheat flour.
Fry on a low flame stirring continuously till it is brown in colour and starts leaving aroma.
Remove from the heat and transfer it into a plate and allow cooling till it is warm in temperature.
Add sugar and cardamom powder. Sprinkle milk, divide the mixture into equal portions and
Decorate each ball with the dry fruit mixture or can mix with mixture.

recipies.description: A fresh spin on salad - dried beans, capsicum and tomatoes dressed in sweet and sour flavours.
recipies.name: Mixed Bean Salad
method: Cook the beans in boiling water until tender.
Toss the cooked beans and sweet lime in a bowl.
Combine all the dressing ingredients. Whisk and season well.
Pour the dressing on the salad and let it chill in the fridge overnight.
Add tomatoes, capsicum and seasoning before serving.
Garnish with onion rings and serve.

recipies.description: A classic French dish where the lobster shell is stuffed with a creamy mixture of meat, egg yolks and brandy. Top up with cheese and bake for an oven-browned cheese crust.
recipies.name: Lobster Thermidor
method: Split the lobster length-wise into two parts and clean the head thoroughly under cold running water.
Scope all the meat from the lobster and clean.  Keep the shell aside for finishing in the oven.
Now dice the Lobster meat. In another pan sauté the garlic and onion & later add the sliced mushrooms.
After the mushroom has slightly dried out add in the lobster meat and de-glaze with 30 ml Cognac.
In another pan, add the rest of the Cognac to the fresh cream and one egg yolk, grate the nutmeg and mix well.
Add this mixture to the pan containing lobster and mix well, mix in the thyme now.
Get the pan off the flame and mix well till it turns thick. Fill the cleaned empty shell of the lobster with this mixture that has been prepared.
Top up the lobster with Gruyère cheese and Parmesan cheese. Finish in a medium hot oven for 4 minutes.

recipies.description: Lean pork sauteed and tossed with salad greens, avocado, jalapenos, cucumbers, sesame oil and spring onions.
ingredients: A pinch of pepper and sugar
recipies.name: Thai Pork Salad
method: Slice the pork pieces. Mix it with a little bit for sesame oil (1 tsp), salt and pepper (1/2 tsp).
Heat some oil in a pan and saute the garlic. Throw in the sliced onions. And finally add the pork. Pork cooks really fast.
Add some fish sauce to it and saute for a while.
In a bowl add the lettuce (cut into halves), avocado, cucumber, shallots, jalapenos, spring onions, a pinch of salt and bell peppers.
Now add to the veggies the dressing ingredients.
Finally add the pork.

recipies.description: Seasonal vegetables and fruits combined with pine nuts to make a healthy salad. Drizzled with a flavorful and light honey-mustard dressing.
recipies.name: Green Salad with Pine Nuts and Honey Mustard Dressing
method: In a bowl mix honey, mustard sauce, lemon juice, salt and pepper.
Add extra virgin olive oil and whisk until the dressing is evenly smooth.
Roast the pine nuts in a pan, till they are light brown in color.
Roughly chop the cucumber, carrot, tomato and keep aside in a bowl.
Chop pear, orange and keep aside on a plate.
Pour some honey mustard dressing on both the vegetables and the fruit.
Transfer the fruits into the bowl containing vegetables.
Toss the fruits and vegetables together.
On a separate plate place lettuce and lightly massage it with some dressing.
Add the tossed fruits and vegetables to the lettuce tossed.

recipies.description: Scallions, Shitakee mushrooms, frisee combined with a mild dressing. Topped with poached egg.
ingredients: 2 cups shitakees - sliced with stems removed
recipies.name: Warm Frisee Salad
method: In a pan saute the scallions and shiitakes for about two minutes in extra virgin olive oil, until softened.
Add Dijon mustard and deglaze with citrus juices, scraping up any caramelized bits in the pan.
Whisk in extra virgin olive oil and truffle oil.
Take frisee in a large bowl and pour hot vinaigrette over salad to wilt, tossing to coat.
Divide salad among four plates, top each with poached egg and serve.

recipies.description: A rich potato salad with loads of mayonnaise and cream. Served on a bed of lettuce leaves with a hint of lemon.
ingredients: Lettuce & parsley or fresh coriander, to garnish
recipies.name: Cream Potato Salad
method: Boil the potatoes and then cube them.
Once they have cooled, add mayonnaise, cream, curry powder, salt & pepper. Mix.
Squeeze the lemon juice over the salad.
Then, arrange the lettuce leaves in the salad bowl, and pile the salad on to it.
Garnish with the coriander & serve chilled.

recipies.description: A delicious and succulent mutton fry recipe made with aromatic spices.
ingredients: 500 gms mutton, chopped in small pieces
recipies.name: Mutton Fry
method: Heat 4 tbsp of oil in a pan and lightly brown the mutton to seal the juices.
Add the ginger garlic paste, salt, chili, ulavacharu paste (optional) and turmeric powder.
Cook for 8-10 minutes on medium flame, stirring at intervals.
Add the water and pressure cook for 20-25 minutes or 4-5 whistles, till the mutton is tender.
In another pan, heat the oil, add cinnamon stick, green cardamom and cloves and let them splutter.
Mix in the  green chillies, then add the onions and curry leaves.
Saute for 5-6 minutes and season it with salt.
Cook on low heat for 6-8 minutes, till the onions are soft.
Then add the cooked mutton  to this base and mix well.
Sprinkle in the
Garnish with coriander.
Serve hot with rice and

recipies.description: Aditya cooks a dish that would have had the Great Mughal Kings licking their fingers - a Raan Mussallam. Mutton and chicken marinated in a variety of spices, cooked on slow fire and topped with a gravy made with fried onions, dry fruits and spices.
ingredients: 100 gms ginger, garlic and green chilli paste
150 gms poppy seed, coconut and cashew nut paste
recipies.name: Raan Musallam
method: In a pan, dry roast the bay leaf, cinnamon, brown cardamom, green cardamom, mace, black pepper, cumin seeds and whole coriander seeds.
Transfer them into mortar and pestle, grind them finely to make fresh garam masala.

In a bowl, mix ginger garlic and chilli paste, hung curd, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, ground poppy coconut cashew nut paste, fried onions, ground garam masala and butter. This is your marinade.
First, apply mustard oil to the chicken breasts and then marinate them.
Next, marinate the raan, place the chicken breasts on it and add a layer of cashew nut and raisins.
Tie and roll up the raan and chicken breast together with the help of a thread.
Cook the the stuffed raan, in ghee, on a slow fire. Once both the sides of the raan are seared, cover and let it cook for an hour.
With the remaining marinade, make a quick gravy by cooking it out in mustard oil and adding a little water to it.
Ladle the gravy on to the cooked Raan.
