Pour the mango dessert into glasses, garnish with mint leaves and allow it to cool. Refrigerate and serve chilled.

recipies.description: Pavlova is a meringue based dessert. A crisp meringue topped with rich, rum and vanilla flavored cream and fruits of your choice.
ingredients: 250 ml whipped cream - flavored with vanilla, rum and sugar
recipies.name: Fresh Fruit Pavlova
method: Beat egg whites until stiff.
Gradually whisk in sugar and then the vinegar, corn flour and essence.
Spoon the meringue onto a foil-lined tray.
Level with a blunt knife.
Bake at 120 degrees C till the meringue is firm. (about 10 minutes)
Peel the meringue off the foil and allow it to cool.
Spread some cream on the meringue base and cover with the fruit.
Sprinkle with sugar and decorate edges with remaining cream.
Serve immediately.

recipies.description: Haleem is a popular curry prepared during Ramzaan with meat and various dals.. Here's a vegetarian version of it made with soy granules. Hyderabadi Haleem is very popular in India.
ingredients: 40-50 gm whole wheat or cracked wheat
recipies.name: Soya Haleem
method: In a blender add ginger, garlic and green chilies and blend into a rough paste.
In a hot pan, fry the onions till golden brown in olive oil. Transfer some into a bowl. Leave the rest in a pan.
Add the red chili powder and the ginger, garlic and green chili paste to the onions in the pan. Stir well till lightly combined.
Add the other spices like cinnamon, cloves, black peppercorns, whole cardamoms, cumin seeds and bay leaves.
Now add the soy granules to the above and saute well.
Then add the green gram, red lentil and black gram. Give it all a nice mix.
Then add the cracked wheat and the leftover cooking water of the dal and 200ml of the vegetable stock.
Mix well till all the ingredients come together.
Add the powder spices- cumin powder, coriander powder, and turmeric powder and garam masala.
Season it with salt and some fresh coriander.
Cook well till all the stock is absorbed and the dal and broken wheat are soft enough to mash or blend.
Garnish it with fresh coriander, mint leaves, chopped green chilies and lime.
Serve hot.

recipies.description: Here's an easy caramel custard recipe with a twist. This one's made in a pressure cooker.
recipies.name: Caramel Custard in a Pressure Cooker
method: Beat the eggs and egg yolks together with vanilla essence.
Add milk while stirring.
Strain the mixture.
Dissolve sugar and water together until caramelized.
Line serving dish with the caramel.
Pour the custard over the caramel. Cover with foil.
Place some water in a pressure cooker (enough for it to last the length of your cooking time).
Now place something like a
Over this place the pudding to be steamed.
The plate should be above the water, not touching it. Seal the pressure cooker and cook without the pressure for about 20 minutes.
Take the pudding out of the cooker, turn upside down into a dish and serve.

recipies.description: A moist and delicious Greek cake made with semolina and citrus flavors. Topped with pomegranate kernels and rum.
recipies.name: Greek Cake
method: Blend all the cake ingredients together and beat for 1 minute.
Turn into a greased and lined 8" round tin and bake at 210 degrees C for 10 minutes and then for 25 minutes at 180 degrees C.
Turn out of tin.
Simmer the syrup ingredients together for 5 minutes and pour over cake.
Serve with pomegranate mixed with rum.
Serve garnished with mint sprigs.

recipies.description: Delicious fruity cake with apple and pears. Served with a thick cinnamon custard.
ingredients: 350 gm cored, peeled and sliced apples
350 gm cored, peeled and sliced pears
recipies.name: Apple and Pear Cake
method: Grease a cake tin and arrange the sliced apples and pears on the base.
Prepare a batter with the remaining ingredients.
Mix well and pour over the fruits.
Bake at 200 degrees C for 30 minutes.
Cool and sprinkle with icing sugar.
Boil milk with cinnamon sticks.
Beat egg yolks along with sugar for 5 minutes.
Combine the eggs with the milk and return to gentle flame.
Stir continuously until the custard thickens.
Strain and serve hot/cold with the cake.

recipies.description: Mini dosas made from soya milk and whole wheat flour.
recipies.name: Mini Soya Dosa
method: Mix all the ingredients together, making a thin batter.
Heat a non-stick pan and grease it with a little oil.
Pour two tablespoons of the batter on the non-stick pan and spread it using a circular motion to make a thin dosa.
Cook on both till they turn golden brown.
Serve hot.

recipies.description: A no sweat, egg-less treat amalgamating the nutty flavor of peanut butter with the crunch of chocolate chips.
recipies.name: Chocolate Peanut Butter Cake
method: Whip the butter, peanut butter and caster sugar in a large bowl.
In the mixture fold in the flour, baking powder and chocolate, one after the another.
Bake at 170 C for 35 minutes and serve.

recipies.description: The classic carrot-pea dish tossed in mild spices is full of flavor and colour.
ingredients: 1/2 Tbsp fenugreek seeds-roasted and coarsely pounded
1 Tbsp fennel seeds-roasted and coarsely pounded
recipies.name: Gajar Matar
method: Heat the
Add the asafoetida and ground spices.
When the spices darken a bit, add the vegetables and stir till they look a little glossy.
Add the coriander powder, chilli powder,
Lower heat and cook uncovered till tender.
Mix in the lemon juice and serve garnished with chopped coriander leaves.

recipies.description: Coffee mousse with chocolate sponge cake covered with chocolate ganache.
tags: Cafe Au Lait & Cream Cheese Mousse
recipies.name: Cafe Au Lait & Cream Cheese Mousse
method: Soak the gelatin in cold water, add little water to coffee powder.
Serve the chilled Cafe Au Lait and Cream Cheese Mousse!

recipies.description: Handful of ingredients mixed up good and baked into a delectable treat.
ingredients: A 10 inch round cake tin, lined with grease-proof paper
recipies.name: Blueberry Cake
method: Mix all the ingredients together, and beat a little with a wooden spoon, till well blended and transfer into the cake tin.
Bake in the pre-heated oven 40-45 minutes or till done (a knife pierced in should come out clean)

recipies.description: Chocolate, honey and fruit flavored cake, makes it an ideal winter dessert!
recipies.name: Sugar-free Chocolate and Fruit Cake
method: In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugar free natura together. Add in the eggs and honey and whip them together.

recipies.description: Smooth as silk, this one is made from mango puree, hung curd and cream.
ingredients: A 10" spring form/loose based cake tin lined with butter paper
recipies.name: Chilled Mango Cheesecake
method: Powder the biscuits by crushing them between two sheets of butter paper, with a rolling pin. Alternately you could use the food processor.
Heat the butter to melt, add the biscuits and mix well. Shut off the heat and add the sugar.
Line the base of the cake tin evenly with the biscuit mixture, patting with a rounded spoon or small bowl. Pat to flatten and make it firm. Leave to cool.

Sprinkle the gelatine in the 1/2 cup water and let it soak. Place into a double boiler or a smaller container which can be placed in a bigger container containing water - the mango pulp, sugar, salt, and the yolks and cook over low heat till well mixed and slightly thickened. This is the `custard'.
When the custard is warm, add the soaked gelatin mixture and continue stirring till it reaches a coating consistency. Remove from heat and leave to cool till the custard is partially set.
Whip cream till thick and when the custard is ready, fold in the mascarpone cheese or the curd and then the cream.
Transfer the mixture to the cake tin, leveling it smooth and leave to set in the refrigerator for 6-8 hours or overnight.
Loosen edges of the cake spring, by passing a blunt knife around it, between cake and sides of pan.
Transfer cake to a serving dish. Decorate the mango slices over the top, and and serve chilled.

recipies.description: A light and healthy soup with the goodness of peas, hint of mint and the creaminess of sour cream.
recipies.name: Peas and Mint Soup
method: Add stalks of mint to the chicken stock.
In a deep pan take some olive oil, add garlic, onions and peas. Let it cook for 3-5 minutes.
Add the chicken stalk to the soup mix and add some salt and pepper. Bring it to a boil and let it simmer for 8-10 minutes.
Blend the soup mix with a blender and add sour cream .Continue to blend until creamy.
Garnish the peas and mint soup with sour cream and mint leaves.

recipies.description: The maida has been substituted with whole wheat flour in this version of the carrot cake. With walnuts and carrots this cake recipe is a delicious option as a wholesome evening treat.
ingredients: 2 cups grated raw carrots, cut in pieces and chopped
1 3/4 cups whole wheat flour, sifted 3 times
1 cup (240 ml) egg substitute or 4 large eggs
recipies.name: Atta Carrot Cake
method: Preheat oven to 350F degrees (180C degrees). Grease and flour a 9 x 13-inch (22.5 x 32.5 cm) pan.
Grate carrots chop pecans.
Place flour, salt, cinnamon, baking soda, baking powder and sugar a bowl and mix.
Turn on kitchen aid machine and quickly increase to med. Run machine for 30 seconds or until ingredients are mixed. Stop. Add beaten eggs very slowly  and then oil. Select high.
Let ingredients get well mixed but don't over beat as it can curdle. You may need to stop the machine and run a spatula around the inside of the container to integrate ingredients.
Remove and stir in carrot and nut mixture. Pour into pan. Bake for 50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
Cool cake on wire rack and cut from center till you have two bases.
Beat till well incorporated. Put in fridge and ice cake when cool.

recipies.description: Crisp outside, buttery and fluffy on the inside. These buttermilk scones are the perfect tea time option. Served with a delectable strawberry jam and whipped cream.
recipies.name: Buttermilk Scones
method: In a big bowl add flour, bicarbonate soda, cream of tartar, butter along with caster sugar and mix.
While mixing keep adding some buttermilk, bring it all together, forming dough and take it out on a board.
Sprinkle some flour on the board and pat the dough to the thickness of your choice.
Cut small pieces of the dough with the cookie cutter and place them on a baking tray.
With the help of a brush touch up the pieces with the beaten egg.
Bake in an oven set at 220degree for about 10-12 minutes.
Server the scones with some whipped cream and strawberry jam on the side.

recipies.description: Beetroot and vodka cured salmon is a great elegant starter. Along with a hit of vodka, this classic recipe gets a new edge and involves no actual cooking.
recipies.name: Beetroot and Vodka Cured Balik Salmon Croissant Canapé
method: Crush the coriander seeds and make a blend with the rest of the ingredients.
Remove the Salmon skin and apply the blend on the salmon generously forming a thick crust.
Leave it to rest in a tray and cover with some weight.
After every 6 hours remove the excessive moisture that has drained from the salmon fillet.
After 24 hours remove scrape of the crust and cut thin slices and shape like flourettes.
For Assembling:
Cut the cucumber into thin slices and roll them in to cigarillos.
Toast the croissant bread and slice. Apply the Philadelphia cheese.
Put the salmon flourettes, poached asparagus and cucumber rolls and garnish with capers, red onion and dill leaves.

recipies.description: Wheat flour worked into dough, rolled out into rotis, stuffed with mouthwatering avocado filling and made into rolls teamed with spicy hummus.
recipies.name: Curried Hummus with Avocado Rolls
method: Blend boiled chickpeas along with garlic cloves, tahini, lemon juice, & curry powder.
Knead a dough of wheat flour, salt,
Roll dough balls gently & cook with
Spread hummus on
Serve it with some hummus drizzled with olive oil & a pinch of red chilli powder

recipies.description: The mouth-watering aroma and the variety of ingredients used to prepare this special steamed John Dory will delight and enchant your senses.
recipies.name: Steamed John Dory, Flavours of India
method: For butter - take all the ingredients in the mixing bowl, whisk until smooth and fine.
Cut John Dory fillet length wise into 4 pieces each.
Marinate it with salt, pepper, red chilli and olive oil.
Steam the fish until done.
Serve with flavoured butter emulsions on a flat serving tray.

recipies.description: Fish Mappas is a Kerala style curry where fish is cooked in creamy coconut milk and served with appams.
ingredients: 4 big cubes of any sea fish
recipies.name: Fish Mappas
method: Heat oil in pan.
Add mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, curry leaves, slit green chillies and sliced onions. Saute till onions turn brown.
Now add coriander powder, mustard powder, chopped tomato, kokum fruits, big cubes of any sea fish and fish stock.
Cover and cook for 5 minutes.
Now remove cover and reduce to a semi dry consistency.
Add coconut milk and let simmer for 2 minutes taking care not to let the milk come to a boil.
Temper with coconut oil; ginger juliennes, chopped garlic, curry leave and chopped shallots.
Serve hot with aapam.

recipies.description: Meen Varutharacha is a fish curry from 'God's own country', Kerala. Marinated pieces of fish cooked in a gravy made with dry coconut, tamarind and red chilli paste. It's fresh, easy and quick!
recipies.name: Fish Varutharacha Curry
method: Cut the fish into small pieces of 1 inch thickness.
Soak tamarind in water. Marinate the fish with turmeric and salt and keep aside.
Take a pan and add 1 tsp coconut oil and add the scraped coconut and fry. When it is dry add small onions and continue to fry.
Fry till the coconut has a dark brown color. Take care not to burn it.
Then add the chilli and coriander powder and fry for some more time.  Turn off the stove and add the garlic and ginger.
Allow the mixture to cool. Then grind to a fine paste in a mixie with water.
Take a vessel, add the paste, tamarind and water. Bring to boil on a high flame and add salt.
Reduce the flame and add the fish pieces. Cook covered. After 5 minutes add the pepper powder and cook uncovered on high flame for 3 minutes.
Reduce the flame and add 1 Tbsp of coconut oil and the curry leaves.
Give the vessel a turn and off the flame.
Add the fenugreek powder, and keep covered on the stove for 10 minutes.
Give the vessel a shake after that and keep covered.

recipies.description: Crisp fried potato chunks filled with spicy tomato salsa and home-made aioli are divinely delicious. Spanish tapas are small potions that can create a light supper or serve as great appetizers.
recipies.name: Patatas Bravas
method: Cut the potatoes into exact halves. Scoop at the center with small scooper.
In a tray put the potatoes & cover with sunflower oil. Cook in the oven at 150 degree for 45 minutes.
In a pan, heat olive oil, add crushed garlic cloves & saute.
Add chopped fresh red chili, saute & add chopped tomatoes. Cook for about an 1 hour, over slow flame.
Season the sauce & blend.
In a bowl break whole egg, add chopped garlic, lemon juice & salt, mix well & start whipping it.
Add olive oil slowly to form an emulsion; whip till mayonnaise / aioli is firm.
Deep fry the potatoes, take out on a paper towel & sprinkle with salt.
Fill the center with spicy tomato sauce & top with garlic aioli.
Garnish with fresh chopped parsley.

recipies.description: Munch on these golden snacks made of a host vegetables bathed in flour and fried to perfection.
ingredients: 1 medium red bell pepper, cut into medium pieces
1 medium yellow bell pepper, cut into medium pieces
1 small green zucchini, cut into medium pieces
1 small yellow zucchini, cut into medium pieces
2 medium onions, cut into medium pieces
recipies.name: Fritto Misto
method: Take all the vegetables in a bowl.
Add crushed peppercorns, salt and lemon juice and mix.
Add olive oil and mix well.
Mix together refined flour and rice flour in a bowl.
Add a little water and mix.
Heat oil in a
Dip vegetables in the batter and deep-fry till golden and crisp.
Drain on an absorbent paper and serve hot.

recipies.description: Rawas fillet crusted with a beetroot, olives and jalapeno paste. Baked. Served with a tangy starfruit relish.
recipies.name: Beetroot Crusted Rawas
method: Rub salt and pepper on the fish fillet. Sear in the pan from both sides in olive oil.
Add all the crust ingredients in a blender. Mix.
Apply the paste on one side of the fish.
Bake for 7-9 minutes at 200 degrees C.
Serve with starfruit relish.
In a bowl mix sliced starfruit, oil, salt, pepper, thyme and vinegar.
Toss and serve.

recipies.description: Aditya Bal cooks a banana leaf wrapped basa fish baked with some fragrant basmati rice in Raghogarh, Madhya Pradesh.
ingredients: A handful of chopped fresh coriander
recipies.name: Khud Style Baked Indian Basa
method: Dry roast the cumin seeds, coriander seeds and fennel seeds,and grind to a powder. Next, char the garlic and grind to a paste with a pinch of salt.
Combine the ground spices and garlic paste with the dry red chilly paste, turmeric powder, salt, lime juice, hung curd and ghee. Mix well.
Add in a handful of chopped coriander to the marinade and then, apply the marinade to the fillets of fish till they are well coated with the paste.
Layer a banana leaf with kitchen foil, make a bed of rice on it, and place the fish carefully on the rice.
Fold the banana leaf over to make a parcel and tie with string.
Place the fish-parcel in an oven on medium heat (or the embers of firewood/dry cow dung ) for 20 minutes.
Unwrap the banana leaf parcel, and serve the fish as is, on the bed of rice.

recipies.description: Cutlets made with prawns and indian spices, coated with a brinjal mix and shallow fried.
recipies.name: Prawn and Brinjal Cutlets
method: Apply little oil over the full brinjal and roast it on the tawa. (like how you make bharta).
Boil one big potato. Grate it.
Peel the brinjal skin and mix the brinjal and grated potato.
Add coriander leaves and salt to taste.
For the masala:
In a pan, take some oil.
Add cinnamon, peppercorns, bay leaves, cloves (ie. garam masala) and dried red chillies.
Add long cut onions. Add grated coconut.
Fry all the ingredients well. Grind this into a course paste.
Avoid adding much water. Keep it dry.
In a pan, take some oil.
Add finely chopped onions. Make it golden brown.
Add (ginger-garlic-green chillies-pudina-coriander leaves) paste - 2-3 Tbsp.
Add jeera and coriander powder.
Add the fresh prawns.
Add the masala you made above, salt to taste and coriander leaves.
Once this mixture has cooled down make small balls.
For the cutlets:
To prepare the cutlet coat the prawns balls with the brinjal mixture and make the cutlets.
Coat it with rice flour and shallow fry it.

recipies.description: The classic samosa recipe with a masala onion filling. Serve it with home-made chutneys and its a clear winner.
recipies.name: Masala Onion Patti Samosa
method: Cut spring roll sheets in 2 inch strips and keep aside.
Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds and wait for crackling.
Now add curry leaves, green chilly, ginger and garlic paste and cook for about 2 minutes.
Check for seasoning and cool to room temperature.
Then add turmeric and sliced onions and cook till the onions turn translucent.
Now add coriander powder and salt. Mix well.
Then add chopped coriander. Mix again and your stuffing is ready.
Now take a tea spoon of the onion stuffing and make rolls with spring roll strips.
Roll to a triangular shape and deep fry these in medium heat till it turns to a golden brown color.

recipies.description: The classic dish from Britain. Hot and crispy deep fried fish with potato fries (known as chips in Britain).
ingredients: 125 gm flour or maida, plus 2 Tbsp
700g skinned cod or haddock, preferably in one piece or any white fish such as bekti
2 litres (approx) sunflower or vegetable oil, for deep frying
recipies.name: Fish and Chips
method: Sift 125 grams flour with the salt, baking powder, turmeric and chilli powder into a mixing bowl and make a well in the center.
Pour half the water into the well and whisk, gradually incorporating the flour from around the bowl to make a thick batter.Whisk in the remaining water.
Cover and leave to stand for 1 hour in the fridge.
Peel and cut the potatoes into 1.5cm thick slices then cut across each slice to make chunky chips.
Put the chips in a bowl, pour in cold water to cover and leave until ready to cook. (You can prepare the potatoes several hours in advance.)
Pat the fish dry with kitchen paper and cut into 4 chunky pieces. Season each piece on both sides.
Cover and refrigerate until you are ready to cook.
Heat the oil in the deep fat fryer or pan with basket to 180-190°C.
While the oil is reaching temperature, thoroughly drain the potatoes and pat dry using plenty of kitchen paper.
Add half the potatoes to the pan and fry for 10-12 minutes until golden and tender. When ready, drain the chips on kitchen paper.
Remove the fish from the fridge and sprinkle with the remaining flour, turning them until they are coated.
Before frying the fish, you will probably need to reduce the heat as the oil will get hotter once the chips are removed.
Dip the pieces of fish in the batter until completely coated.
Carefully lower the fish into the hot fat. Fry for about 4 minutes until crisp and golden on the outside.
Drain on kitchen paper on a plate and keep warm while coating and frying the remaining pieces.
Serve hot with the chips, mushy peas and lemon wedges.

recipies.description: A comforting curry which is a fresh mix of Southern veggies like raw banana, ash gourd, drumsticks, yam and coconut.
recipies.name: Kerala-Style Avial
method: Add sufficient water and grind the coconut, chillies and cumin seeds into a fine paste.
Add the whipped yoghurt to the paste and mix well.
Cut all the vegetables into batons, 3 inches* 1 inch in size.
Heat 300 ml of water and add the vegetables. When the vegetables are half cooked
Add the paste and the curry leaves.
Mix and bring it to a boil. When the vegetables are completely cooked
Drizzle with coconut oil and serve hot.

recipies.description: Surmai fish pieces marinated in a delectable masala, pan fried till crisp.
recipies.name: Chettinad Fish Fry
method: Cut the fish fillets into equal medium sized pieces.
In a pan, dry roast garlic, ginger, cumin, fennel, coriander seeds, black peppercorns, mustard seeds and curry leaves.
Pound them in a mortar and pestle. Add a little salt, oil and water to help in the procedure.
Now add the chopped tomato, turmeric powder, red chili powder, salt and tamarind extract.
Pound them together till pulp like and spread it over the fish pieces.
Sprinkle some cornflour over the fish. The cornflour helps the masala to stick
Marinate the fish and keep in the fridge for 15-20 minutes.
In a pan, fry the fish with the refined oil and serve hot.

recipies.description: A lip smacking Georgian side dish. Eggplant slices grilled and stuffed with a walnut mixture.
recipies.name: Georgian Eggplant with Walnuts
method: Wash the small eggplants, cut them lengthwise, sprinkle with salt on both sides and let sweat on paper towels.
After an hour squeeze to release excess liquid and grill. Allow the eggplant to cool.
To prepare the stuffing: fry the walnuts with the chopped onion, garlic, curry powder, clove powder, parsley, coriander,  salt and pepper.
Add the stuffing into a mixer with olive oil and blend into a thick chunky paste.
Soak saffron in red wine vinegar.
Fry the stuffing mixture in a hot pan for a few minutes and deglaze with the saffron infused red wine vinegar.
Add the stuffing into a mixer with olive oil and blend into a thick chunky paste.
Spread about a teaspoon of the stuffing on each of the eggplants and fold over. Sprinkle with a few pomegranate seeds if available and serve immediately.
In a blender, blitz the coriander leaves, yogurt and olive oil to make a nice luscious sauce.
Serve the sauce with the eggplants.

recipies.description: The all time favorite tea time snack, only this time it is made with singhare ka atta (water chestnut flour). So now you can feast on these while fasting.
ingredients: 1 cup (120 gm) singhare ka atta (water chestnut flour)
recipies.name: Singhare ke Atte ka Samosa
method: Remove the husk of the chironji and grind coarsely.
Heat the 2 tbsp ghee, in a pan and add the zeera. When it splutters, add chironji and rest of the filling ingredients.
Saute over low heat till mixture is well fried. Leave to cool.
Place the water, ghee and 1 tsp salt in a pan and bring to a boil.
As soon as it comes to a boil, put in the atta and arrowroot and mix well, over low heat, till it collects together in the center.
Take the dough off the heat and leave to cool.
Roll dough (using dry flour or arrowroot if it sticks) into 1/8" thick rounds, 3" diameter, and cut into halves.
Take one half, wet the edges. Fold the straight edge at the center and join overlapping the other edge to form into a cone.
Press the overlapping portion, and fill the cone with the filling, and press the edges together to seal the `Samosa'. Repeat, with the rest of the pieces.
Heat the ghee and over high heat, add as many samosas as come in without touching.
Lower the heat to medium and fry to a golden brown on either side.

recipies.description: Raw bananas cooked, mashed and shaped like kebabs. Stuffed with a mixture of cheese, figs, chillies, pomegranate seeds and deep fried.
ingredients: A little bit of lemon rind
recipies.name: Raw Banana Kebab
method: Cut the ends of the bananas and make a slit. Cook them for five to seven minutes.
Cool the cooked bananas by putting them in cold water. Peel and mash them well.
Add butter, salt and mashed bananas in a pan.
When the mixture turns a little pink, add cardamom powder, cinnamon powder, white pepper powder, rose petal powder, ginger and saunf powder.
Cook for sometime and then cool.
Mix cheese, figs, coriander leaves, green chillies, pomegranate seeds, lemon juice and salt.
Add wheat flour and corn flour to the cooled banana mixture and mix well. Now add lemon rind and lemon juice.
Shape the banana mixture into koftas, add the filling and seal the edges.
Heat oil in a pan and deep fry the kebabs till golden brown. Serve hot.

recipies.description: Stuffed with loads of vegetables and shrimps these cold spring rolls are best served with a chilly sauce and peanuts dip.
ingredients: 1 packet clear edible rice paper sheets
200 gm cooked small shrimp (peeled, deveined, halved)
1 head lettuce, washed and separated into leaves
100 gm cucumber, peeled and cut into very, very thin strips
100 gm carrot peeled and cut into thin strips
1 package vermicelli rice noodles, prepared according to package directions
Hoisin sauce and sweet chilly sauce to taste
recipies.name: Vietnamese Cold Spring Rolls
method: Cook the noodle as per the packet instruction and keep aside.

Make sure all veggies and herbs are cleaned, dried, and set out before you start. Dip a sheet of rice paper wrapper into water very quickly, no longer than a second or two (or they will get too soggy) and lay flat on a work surface.

On one edge, lay a small handful of noodles, some shrimp, some coriander and mint leaves, a lettuce leaf, some cucumber strips carrot and spring onion and bean sprouts, all to taste but don't over stuff.
Carefully start to roll up, burrito style, tucking in the sides, then continue to roll up but not too tightly or the spring roll will split.
These rolls will be thicker than the typical Chinese-style fried spring rolls.

Combine a few spoon full of Hoisin sauce and chilly sauce with some chopped peanuts to use as a dipping sauce. I like to put a few drops of sauce even inside the stuffing, but that entirely is up to you.
Serve immediately - these do not keep and will harden up in the fridge, so it is best to make just as many as you plan to serve.
Note: Please be sure to get the correct spring roll rice papers - these are not the same as wonton/spring roll wrappers, which must be cooked.

recipies.description: Healthy vegetarian kebabs with spinach, peas and potatoes, shallow fried.
recipies.name: Hara Bhara Kebabs
method: In a food processor, grind boiled spinach, peas till a smooth paste is formed.
Put the grinded mix in a bowl; add mashed potatoes, ginger,
Add flour to the mix so that it binds well.
Put some oil in pan and fry on simmer till the kebabs till they are crusty and crisp.
Soak excess oil on a tissue paper.
Serve with chutney.

recipies.description: A millet based kadhi which goes well with a piping hot plate of boiled rice.
ingredients: 1/2 cup jhingora (a kind of millet)* - soaked for 3-4 hours, drained and ground to a paste
1 cup sour yogurt diluted with 2 cups water
recipies.name: Garhwali Kadhi
method: Dissolve the ground paste into the water and yogurt mixture.
Add the asafoetida, turmeric, chilli powder, salt and coriander powder.
Heat the oil and add the cumin seeds.
When they splutter, add the yogurt mixture and bring to a boil, stirring to avoid scorching.
Simmer for 5 minutes or so, till it thicken a bit.
Serve hot.

recipies.description: Here's the recipe of an ideal party starter. Kebabs made with the distinctive flavors of lotus stems, chana dal and mild spices.
ingredients: 1 tsp salt or to taste green chillies-chopped fine to taste
Onion rings and lemon wedges to garnish
recipies.name: Bhein Ke Kebab
method: Place
Bring to a boil, lower the heat and cook, covered till soft.
Remove from heat and when cool grind to a thick dough-like paste.
Mix the salt, chillies, onions and coriander and form into small flat rounds (about 1").
Heat the oil in a non-stick frying pan and pan-fry on both sides till brown.
Serve hot garnished with the onion rings an lemon wedges, with a green chutney on the side.
You can make

recipies.description: Have had enough of aloo filled samosas? Then try making these moong dal samosas at home.
recipies.name: Moong Daal Samosa
method: Add the salt to the flour, and rub the oil into it.
Add water and knead into a stiff dough (It is important for the dough to be stiff). Leave to rest for 15 minutes or so.
Shape dough into smooth balls, and roll the balls into thin rounds. Cut these into halves.
Take one half, wet the edges, and fold the straight edge at the center and join by one half overlapping the other to form into a cone.
Press the overlapping portion, and fill the cone and press the edges together to seal. The oil should be hot when you add the
Grind the lentils coarsely. Heat 2 tablespoons of oil and add the cumin seeds and asafoetida.
When they begin to splutter, add the lentils and the rest of the ingredients, which make up the filling.
Saute over low heat till the mixture is well fried. It will stop sticking to the pan when done.
Take mixture off heat and leave to cool.

recipies.description: Sanaas are toddy fermented rice cakes that can be eaten as it is or with some vindaloo. Warm, soft and fluffy sannas are similar to idlis.
recipies.name: Sannas
method: Wash and soak the rice overnight. Drain and grind the rice finely with toddy.
Add grated coconut and make a thick batter.
Add sugar, cover and keep in a warm place for about 3 hours or until the batter ferments.
Add salt to the batter and mix thoroughly.
Pour the batter into shallow round moulds and steam for 15 minutes.

recipies.description: Succulent deep fried meat kebabs with aromatic flavors and masalas. Served with a chilli garlic chutney.
recipies.name: Cocktail Shami Kebab
method: Cook meat, onions, garlic, chilli powder, ginger and
Cool and grind.
Bind with the egg and add the remaining ingredients.
Knead well. Shape into small, flat roundels and deep fry.
Serve with chutney.
Grind all ingredients to a paste.
Season and serve at room temperature.

recipies.description: Melt in your mouth kebabs made of mushrooms, potato and coated with rich flavours. Served with a mango pickle sauce.
recipies.name: Potato Mushroom Kebabs
method: Boil the potatoes on slow heat until fully boiled.
Mash the potatoes and put in rest of the ingredients one by one.
Make kebabs of desired shape.
For the batter, add 1 cup water in gram flour and mix with red chili powder, salt, cumin and carom seeds.
Coat the kebabs with batter and cook on slow heat until they get a lightly golden colour.
Serve with achari sauce.
Add mango pickle, red chilli powder, salt and garlic into warm water.
Bring to a boil.
Add boiled, mashed potato for thickness.
Strain sauce.
Then add lemon juice and mix. Sauce is ready.

recipies.description: Avial is a traditional south Indian dish from Kerala. A thick mixture of vegetables like drumsticks, potatoes and carrots are cooked in coconut oil and mustard seeds. Served with red rice.
ingredients: A small piece of raw mango
recipies.name: Avial with Kerala Red Rice
method: Boil red rice in 7 cups of water for an hour.
Boil potatoes and carrots separately and keep aside.
Take some water in a saucepan. Add chopped raw banana, drumsticks, beans, onion and raw mango.
Then season with salt and turmeric powder. Stir well and let it steam for 2-3 minutes.
Then add green chillies, coconut oil and mustard seeds.
Once the vegetables are steamed, add the boiled potato and carrot along with some curd.
Finally add mustard seeds with coconut oil and mix it well.

recipies.description: Julienned vegetables, glass noodles and fish sauce dressing wrapped in rice paper.
ingredients: 1 cup glass noodles or mung bean noodles
recipies.name: Vietnamese Rice Paper Wraps
method: Salad: Mix together glass noodles, radish, carrot, cucumber, fish sauce, soy sauce, toasted peanuts, mint and lime juice. Add salt and pepper to taste.
On a wet kitchen towel, lay out the rice wrappers. Layer the iceberg lettuce on to the rice wrapper.
Mix together all the ingredients. Serve.

recipies.description: Pockets of dough stuffed with a potato mixture, deep fried. An all time favorite tea time snack!
ingredients: 500 gm potatoes - boiled, peeled and chopped
Oil for deep frying the samosas
recipies.name: Punjabi Samosa
method: Chop the green chillies, ginger and the coriander leaves.
Mix all the ingredients for the dough except water and rub thoroughly.
Sprinkle water and make a hard dough. Set aside for about 10 minutes.
Divide the dough into round portions as per the size of the
Heat the
Add the rest of the ingredients excluding the final four and sauté for five minutes.
Mix in the rest of the ingredients, including the potatoes and mix well.
Roll each portion of dough into a thin oval shape cut into 2 semi-circles.

Take a semi-circle. Apply water on the straight edge of the semi-circle. Hold the semi-circle in your hand, fold the straight edge, bringing together the watered edges, seal the watered edges into a triangular pocket.
Stuff the potato mixture and then seal the upper edges.
Repeat with the rest.
Deep fry in oil till golden brown and serve.

recipies.description: Kala channas tossed with potatoes and masalas with a lemon sprinkle.
recipies.name: Kale Channe ki Chaat
method: Wash the channas and boil in fresh water till cooked but not mashed (bite-like).
Drain and cool.
Mix all the ingredients together and serve.
Adjust

recipies.description: Lively onion mixture, tomato paste, seasoning and oils spread on pastry rolls and baked crisp.
recipies.name: Red Onion Galettes
method: Heat 2 table spoon oil in a frying pan and add the onions and the garlic.
Cover and cook for approximately 20 minutes till they turn soft. Stir in the herbs.
Preheat the oven to 200 degree C.
Divide the pastry into four and roll out each of them into a 15cm/6 inches round.
Flute the edges and prick it all over with a fork and place on baking sheets.
Chill the rounds on the baking sheets in the fridge for about 10 minutes.
Mix in the remainder of the olive oil with the tomato paste and spread over the pastry rounds.
Spread the onion mixture over the pastry and season with pepper.
Drizzle over a little oil and then place them on the baking sheets in the preheated oven for 15 minutes, till they turn crisp.
Serve garnished with thyme sprigs.

recipies.description: Prawns marinated in an array of creams and masalas, grilled in a tandoor.
recipies.name: Tandoori Tiger Prawns
method: Put prawns in a bowl, add all the ingredients to it and mix well.
Marinate for two hours.
Cook in the tandoor or grill in the oven at medium temperature for about 15 minutes or till well done.
Garnish and serve.

recipies.description: Cookies with the flow of semolina, crunch of cashews and delicious flavor of coconut.
recipies.name: Bolinhas (Goan Cookies)
method: Beat egg yolks and sugar to a light and creamy consistency.
Mix in the rest of the ingredients except the coconut and keep covered for 8 hours.
Mix in the coconut.
Shape into small balls (about 12), flatten slightly and place on the baking tray.
Bake in a pre-heated oven till brown.

recipies.description: A terribly easy and maseladaar recipe. Kale channe cooked in a pool of masalas. It is usually served as a prasad after pujas or during navratri. Goes best with hot puris.
ingredients: A pinch of red chilly powder
recipies.name: Sookhe Kale Channe
method: Wash the channas and boil in fresh water till cooked but not mashed. (Use a pressure cooker and till one whistle goes off).
Drain and cool.
Heat the oil in a pan and add the ginger.
Saute till ginger changes colour a bit and add the rest of the ingredients along with the channas, except the lemon juice.
Cook for about 2 minutes, serve garnished with lemon juice.
You can adjust the masalas according to your taste.

recipies.description: A medley of vegetables, drizzled with an enticing cheesy sauce and baked perfect.
ingredients: 250 gm mixed vegetables-chopped and cooked till bite like
A few tomato slices for garnish
recipies.name: Baked Vegetables
method: Mix all the ingredients together and keep stirring to avoid lumps.
Melt the butter add onions and stir-fry till they look glossy.
Add the mixed vegetables and continue to stir-fry over high heat till vegetables look like they are coated with the butter.
Take it off the heat and mix in the salt, pepper and white sauce.
Transfer mixture into an oven proof serving dish.
Sprinkle the cheese to cover the mixture, garnish with the tomato slices and bake in a pre-heated oven for half an hour, or till cheese is slightly brown.

recipies.description: This potato sabzi is eaten during fasts. Normal salt is replaced with sendha namak or rock salt.
ingredients: 500 gm potatoes - chopped to small pieces
recipies.name: Aloo Rasedaar Vrat-wale
method: Heat the
Add the ginger powder, salt and chilli powder and stir a few times, till well mixed.
Then add the potatoes and turn over high heat, till they look slightly fried.
Add about 2 cups water and bring to a boil.
Simmer uncovered for about 15 minutes, till tender. Serve hot with

recipies.description: A delicious Hyderabadi mirch ka salan served with an aromatic biryani and a bowl full of chilled raita.
recipies.name: Hyderabadi Mirch Ka Salan
method: Slit and deep fry the green chillies in hot oil. Remove and keep aside.
Roast and grind together ingredients for the paste.
Soak the tamarind in a cup of water and extract pulp.
Heat oil and add the mustard seeds, when crackling add the cloves and the curry leaves.
Mix the sauteed onion paste and stir for 3 minutes.
Add the
Pour 15 ml of water at intervals to avoid paste sticking to the pan.
Add the tamarind pulp and 50 ml of water.
Stir for 5 minutes until the gravy resembles the consistency of a sauce.
Add the salt and the fried chillies to the hot gravy. Boil the gravy for 1 minute.
Remove and garnish with finely chopped coriander leaves.

recipies.description: Pieces of yams cooked in a zesty sauce with tamarind and jaggery.
recipies.name: Yams in Tamarind Sauce
method: Roast all ingredients except the mustard,
Boil yam with salt and
Heat oil. Add mustard, red chilies,
Add
Add yam pieces and cook till the sauce starts to reduce and thicken.
Serve.

recipies.description: Channa dal and carrots cooked with coconut, jaggery, tamarind and curry leaves.
recipies.name: Carrot Gojju
method: In a pan, saute coconut oil, smashed ginger, smashed whole green chilies, cumin seeds, coriander seeds, black pepper, chana dal, coriander leaves, sea salt and half grated coconut.
Pound them in mortar and pestle with little bit of water.
In a kadai add coconut oil, mustard seeds and curry leaves. Stir them well together .
Add the pounded paste into the kadai. Stir them well.
Add little water, tamarind extract and jaggery. Combine them well together.
Add sliced carrot and little water. Mix them well together.
Cover it and let them simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve hot.

recipies.description: Bottle gourd marinated and stuffed with potatoes. A rich gravy with dry fruits, yogurt, nutmeg and cardamom poured over it and served.
recipies.name: Bottle Gourd Mussallam
method: Peel and cut bottle gourd into four large round pieces. Scoop out the seeds.
Marinate with garlic paste, ginger paste, turmeric, red chilli powder and lemon juice for five to ten minutes.
Boil, peel and cut the potato into small pieces.
Heat oil in a pan and fry the bottle gourd pieces till golden brown.
Heat desi ghee in a pan and add chopped onions.
As they turn brown add ginger, green chillies, kishmish, almond flakes, cashew nuts, khoya and sunflower seeds.
Saute and add the potato pieces. Add salt and allow it to cool for some time. Now stuff the bottle gourd pieces with the filling.
Heat desi ghee in a pan. Add cashew paste, whisked yoghurt, fennel powder, mace powder, nutmeg powder, green cardamom powder, water, salt and red chilli powder.
Pour the gravy over the bottle gourd pieces and serve hot.

recipies.description: Fried chunks of banana tossed with coconut and jaggery. Tempered with mustard seeds and curry leaves. Served with plain steamed rice.
ingredients: 2 large raw bananas - peeled and chunked
recipies.name: Spiced Banana Curry
method: Heat 1 tbsp oil and fry the red chillies for 5 seconds.
Fry bananas in remaining hot oil until colored. Drain.
Grind coconut and green chillies to a fine paste.
Mix with jaggery and salt.
Cook in 1 tbsp chilli oil for 5 minutes over a moderate heat.
Add yoghurt to the pan. Stir and fry for 5 minutes.
Add the banana pieces to the pan and heat through.
In a separate pan, heat 2 tsp oil.
Toss in curry leaves, mustard and cumin seeds. Fry lightly and pour over banana curry.
Garnish and serve with boiled rice.

recipies.description: Babycorn marinated and deep fried, tossed in masala and served with a peanut chutney.
ingredients: 3 tsp garam masala powder salt to taste
recipies.name: Babycorn Bezule with Peanut Chutney
method: Clean and wash the babycorn, marinate with lime juice, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, degi mirch powder, garam masala powder and salt.
Add the rice flour and corn flour, mix well.
Fry the babycorn until cooked and keep aside.
Heat the coconut oil in a pan; add mustard seeds let them crackle. Then add sliced shallots, slit green chilies, ginger and curry leaves saute for few minutes.
Now add the yogurt and the fried babycorn saute for another 2 minutes.
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Serve hot on banana leaves with peanut chutney.
To make the chutney, toast the peanuts and coconut in a pan.
Add oil, chopped ginger, garlic, onions, dry red chilli and tamarind pulp.
Prepare mustard seed and curry leaf tempering in coconut oil.
Add this tempering and grind to a coarse paste.
Adjust seasoning and serve.

recipies.description: Carrots with an added punch. Cooked with rich flavours, perfect as it is or as an accompaniment.
recipies.name: Spicy Wisey Carrots
method: Cut the carrots into medium sized batons.
Blanch for 5 minutes in salted water. Drain and cool.
Temper the jeera, fennel seeds and green chilies in a pan of hot oil.
Heat up a little olive oil and sweat the spring onions, spring onion greens, green chilies and
Add the ginger, clove, cardamom, red chilli powder.
Cook for a minute.
Add the jaggery and deglaze with apple cider vinegar.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Serve in a bowl.
Garnish with freshly grated coconut and fresh coriander leaves.

recipies.description: Beetroot and feta are cooked in red wine vinegar reduction and served with olives.
ingredients: 1 medium sized beetroot, baked and peeled
recipies.name: Pickled Beetroot with Feta
method: In a pan, heat red wine vinegar along with brown sugar.
Let it cook till the sugar melts and the reduction starts to thicken.
Slice the beetroot and pour the wine reduction over it. Mix them together well.
Crumble feta cheese over the beets and season with salt.
Then add cracked black pepper and green olives. Mix them well.
Garnish with a sprig of cilantro.
Finish with a dash of olive oil.

recipies.description: Marinated and full of flavour, cottage cheese slices are wrapped with grilled strips of zucchini.
ingredients: 1/2 cup each black and green olives
recipies.name: Grilled Zucchini with Cottage Cheese
method: Grill thin slices of the zucchinil.
In a mixer add green and black olives, a handful of parsley, basil leaves, salt and jalapeno chilies and olive oil mix into a nice paste.
Cut the cottage cheese into squares and sprinkle with some cracked black pepper.
Marinate the cottage cheese squares with the paste.
Wrap the cottage cheese with the grilled strips of zucchini.
And serve with a little lemon zest and citrus olive extract.

recipies.description: Freshly made pie dough filled in with a diverse mixture ranging from peppers, pumpkin, herbs to cottage cheese, leeks and celery, baked and served with salad.
recipies.name: Pumpkin and Spinach Pie
method: Pre heat the oven at 180 C for 9-10 minutes.
In a stainless steel bowl, sift the flour 2 - 3 times.
Add cubes of cold butter to the flour and rub in till the mixture resembles bread crumbs.
Add the parmesan cheese, cracked black pepper, pinch of salt and rosemary.
Mix in the cold water and form semi-stiff dough.
Wrap in cling film and rest for 30- 40 minutes in the refrigerator.
In the meanwhile, start with the filling.
Season the pumpkin with salt and pepper.
Put a teaspoon of olive oil and roast in the oven till soft for about 20 to 30 minutes.
On the same tray season the red bell pepper and roast for 15 minutes.
Once done, peel and dice the peppers and the pumpkin.
Sweat the onions, leeks, celery, garlic, green chilies in a little olive oil.
Add the bell peppers and the pumpkin, spices, herbs and cottage cheese and saute for 2 to 3
Season the mixture with salt and pepper.
Once mixed, add in the cheddar cheese.
This is the filling for the pie.
Cool the filling and bring it to room temperature.
On a floured surface, divide the dough into two parts.
Roll the dough to a 2 cm thickness and place in the pie dish.
Bake the pie dough for 10 minutes @ 170°c.
Cool the baked base and then add the filling evenly.
Roll the rest of the dough to a 3 cm thickness and cover the pie.
Trim the excess of the dough and bake the pie for 20 minutes @ 165°c until the cover and
Rest the pie for 20 minutes and cut into wedges.
Serve with some salad.

recipies.description: Potatoes fried in a thick coating of poppy seeds is a signature dish from Bengal.
recipies.name: Aloo Posto
method: Roast the poppy seeds for about a minute. Grind the roasted poppy seeds and green chillies into a paste with some water.

recipies.description: Bharwan aloo are north Indian starters in which potato cases are stuffed with paneer, spices and baked golden.
recipies.name: Bharwan Aloo
method: Pre-heat the oven to 220 C.
Peel potatoes, slice off a little of the top and scoop out the inside leaving a shell.
Boil the scooped out potato and potato shells till the shells are cooked but firm.
Glaze the potato shells with some oil, keep aside.
In a bowl, put the
Mix and mash it all together, add the salt and pepper and mix again.
Stuff the potato shells with the mixture.
Bake in the oven for 15 minutes or in an OTG for 10 minutes.
Cut into halves lengthwise, garnish.
Your bharwan aloo are ready to serve.

recipies.description: Crispy deep fried vegetables served with a freshly made Thai sauce.
ingredients: 1 kg assorted vegetables cut into medium sized pieces
recipies.name: Battered Vegetables with Thai sauce
method: Combine egg yolks, flour, water and salt. Stir well to make a smooth batter.
Dust the vegetables with flour before dipping into the batter.
Deep fry in oil until crisp and golden.
For the sauce:
Heat oil in a pan. Add fish sauce, ginger and chillies. Sauté until soft. Remove from the heat. Add coriander, sugar, and soya sauce and lemon juice.
Serve the sauce along with battered vegetables

recipies.description: A sweet glaze gives an unexpected twist to simply cooked potatoes
recipies.name: Honey Glazed Potatoes
method: Cover the potatoes with salted water.
Cook until tender, drain. In a large pan, melt butter over medium heat.
Stir in water, honey, salt and pepper.
Add potatoes and stirring occasionally, cook potatoes (trying to keep in one layer) 10 to 12 minutes or until brown.

recipies.description: Thoroughly cooked bottle gourd served with cream. Call it ghiya, lauki or bottle gourd. This cream style ghiya recipe is a hit on the dining table.
ingredients: 2 cups (500 g) ghiya/ lauki (bottle gourd), peeled and cut into small pieces, 1 1/2cms/ 3/4" thick
1 Tbsp finely chopped green chillies for garnish
recipies.name: Ghiya Malaiwala
method: Heat the ghee in a heavy based pan and add the jeera.
When they begin to splutter, add the vegetables and the salt and turn around a few times over high heat, till they look glossy.
Lower the heat, cover and let cook till tender.
Add the cream, mix well and serve hot garnished with the coriander leaves and chillies.

recipies.description: Torai cooked in a variety of spices.
recipies.name: Torai ki Sabzi
method: Peel and chop the vegetables into pieces about 1 cm thick.
Discard hard seeds if any.
Place the chopped vegetable in water till ready to use.
Heat the clarified butter in a
As the seeds splutter, add the ginger; saute a little and add the chopped snake gourd; stir-fry over high heat till it looks glossy.
Add the chilli powder, coriander powder, salt,
Cover and simmer till cooked, stirring a few times to avoid scorching.
You may need to add a little water if it sticks to the pan.
When soft and cooked through, serve garnished with fresh coriander leaves.

recipies.description: colocasia or arbi fried crisp in distinct flavours.
recipies.name: Sabut Arbi
method: Wash the colacasia and boil till almost tender.
Peel the skin off when cool enough to handle, and press between palms to flatten.
Heat the oil and put in as many pieces as will fit without touching each other, and fry over high heat till golden brown and crisp.
When all the pieces are fried, heat a heavy-based pan over high flame and add the
When they begin to pop, add the fried colacasia, mango powder, salt, chilli powder and black pepper.
Stir well. Serve hot, garnished with chopped coriander leaves and lemon wedges.

recipies.description: Gatte ki sabzi is a very popular Rajasthani curry. Golden fried gattas made with gram flour, cooked in thick gravy.
recipies.name: Gatte Rasedaar
method: Sieve the gram flour, add salt, chilli powder and turmeric powder.
Mix
Add water, knead into a stiff dough which is also smooth, glossy and comes off clean from the kneading surface. Cover and keep aside for about 15 minutes.
Put 4 cups of water to boil in a pan. Meanwhile, shape the dough into cylinders and long enough to fit comfortably in the pan without touching the sides.
Once water begins to boil, immerse cylinders and leave to simmer till they float up and have small light bubbles on the surface.
Spoon the cylinders out of the water and keep aside to cool. Do not discard the water.
Once the cylinder cools, slice and make discs to make
Heat the oil and add the cumin seeds and the asafoetida.
When the seeds begin to splutter, add the tomatoes and cook till the oil separates.
Add the turmeric, salt, coriander,
To the liquid add some plain water to complete 3 cups and add to the above gravy.
Bring to a boil, then leave to simmer-uncovered for about 15 minutes.
Whisk the yoghurt till smooth and add to the gravy.
Mix well and then spoon in the
Simmer for 10-15 minutes, till the gravy looks well blended.
Serve hot, garnished with coriander leaves.

recipies.description: Cauliflower cooked with a deep and thick gravy in a microwave
ingredients: 1/2 cup tomatoes-blanched, peeled and chopped fine
recipies.name: Gobhi Mussallam
method: Mix together the water, lemon juice and the salt.
Cut off the stem of the cauliflower right till the base. Prick with a sharp knife all over.
Place the cauliflower in a deep dish and sprinkle with the lemon juice mixture all over and around it.
Cover and cook at HI for 12-15 minutes, till almost cooked, but firm. If not, cook further till done. Remove from the dish and keep aside.
Place oil in a dish and cook uncovered at HI for 1 minute.
Add the onions and cook uncovered at HI for 5 minutes, stirring once, to a light brown.
Add the grated onions, mix well and cook uncovered at HI for 5 minutes, stirring once.
Add the ginger and the garlic paste and cook uncovered at HI for 1 minute.
Add the coriander, cumin, chilli powder, turmeric and the tomatoes.
Cook covered at HI for 5 minutes.
Add to this the blended tomato and cook covered at 70% for 5 minutes.
Add salt to this gravy.
Place the cauliflower upside-down in the dish and cover with the gravy.
Cook covered at 70% for 5 minutes.
Turn and cook covered at 70% for 5 minutes, basting it with the
Serve hot garnished with cardamom powder and the

recipies.description: Paneer cubes rolled in a tangy mixture, fried and served on a bed of onions and greens.
ingredients: 2 Tbsp green chillies-thickly sliced or to taste
1 Tbsp Soya sauce (adjust according to strength)
recipies.name: Chilli Paneer
method: Mix together the
Heat the oil, and fry
Heat 2 tbsp of the oil in a wok, and stir fry the onions in it over high heat till they look 'wet'.
Add the green chillies and stir a few times, add the remaining salt, soya sauce, vinegar, MSG and the
Mix well, and serve garnished with some greens.

recipies.description: Tofu and potatoes balls fried with a range of seasoning and served in gravy.
recipies.name: Tofu Kofta
method: Crumble tofu. Boil, peel and mash potatoes.
Mix tofu, mashed potatoes and all the other ingredients listed under
Make balls of the mixture and deep fry carefully. Keep aside.
Heat 1 tbsp oil in a pan, add chopped onions, ginger paste and garlic paste.
Stir till the onions turn golden brown, remove from heat. Cool and grind into a paste.
Heat 1 tbsp oil in a pan, add onion paste, tomato puree, turmeric powder, red chilli powder and salt.
Add a little water if necessary to make a thick gravy.
Cook for five minutes while stirring occasionally.
Add coconut powder and
Bring to boil, add
Serve hot with

recipies.description: Matar (peas) cooked tender in asafoetida, cumin seeds, mango powder and whole red chilies.
recipies.name: Sabut Matar ki Sabzi
method: Wash the matar and leave to drain the excess water.
Heat oil in a
When the seeds begin to splutter, add the matar and salt.
Mix the matar and the masalas well, cover and simmer till the matar is cooked through.This should take around 10-20 minutes depending upon how fresh the matar is.
Add the
Stir to mix and serve the sabut matar ki sabzi, garnished with the chopped coriander leaves.

recipies.description: Dough parcels stuffed with a spice and lentil mixture and cooked on a griddle. A typical street food from Mumbai. Commonly made during the festive season.
ingredients: 1 cup jaggery (you can use sugar also)
2 cups maida (you can use whole wheat flour also)
recipies.name: Pooran Poli
method: Wash and pressure cook the
Heat the
Dissolve the saffron in a little water. Add the cardamom and nutmeg powder, mace powder, saffron liquid and mix well.
Cool and divide it into twelve equal portions and keep aside.
Combine the flour and oil and knead into a soft dough using water. Divide into twelve equal portions and keep aside.
Roll out a portion of the dough into a circle. Place a portion of the filling mixture and fold the edges of the dough over the filling.
Pinch the edges together to seal the filling in. Flatten the dough and roll again into a 4 inches diameter circle.
Cook over a griddle over a medium flame till it turns a golden brown in color on both sides.

recipies.description: Muruku or Chakli as popularly known in Maharashtra is an all-day crispy snack made of rice flour, and piped in hot oil in a round shape.
recipies.name: Ajwaini Chakli
method: In bowl, mix both flours.
Add salt, red chilly powder, black pepper, heeng and ajwain.
Pour canola oil and mix with a light hand.
Now add water and make into dough. Do not over knead the dough or knead stiff dough.
Heat canola oil in Kadhai until medium hot.
Now place dough in the chakli press and in quick round motion, make chaklis on oiled surface.
Carefully pick chakli and deep-fry until crisp.
Note: Once you have mastered the chakli, you can also directly shape the chakli in the Kadhai.

recipies.description: Assorted fruits coated with spices and honey, roasted and served warm.
recipies.name: Grilled Fruit Chaat Bites
method: Rub mustard oil, balsamic vinegar, malt vinegar, anaardana powder, sugar, crushed black pepper, deghi mirch and roasted cumin powder. Keep rubbing the mix for 5 minutes to make a good blend.
To this blend add black salt, garam masala, salt, honey and hing. Thicken this mixture with roasted chana dal powder.
Cut the fruits in bite size pieces. Coat with the marinade and immediately roast on a sigri or in a hot oven.
Serve warm.

recipies.description: Char grilled corn and capsicum tossed with an aromatic garam masala, onions, coconut, tamarind and jaggery.
ingredients: 2 capsicums, julienne (1 stir fried on a pan; 1 char grilled on the stove and then the skin removed)
2 corn on the cob/ bhutta, char grilled on the stove and cut into 2 cm roundels
Lemon juice, to drizzle on top
recipies.name: Handi Corn Sabzi
method: In a pan dry roast all the garam masala ingredients. Pound them in a mortar and pestle. Keep aside.
In a pan add oil, cumin, tuar dal and channa dal. Saute and add curry leaves, green chillies.
Add sliced onions, garlic and ginger. Once the onions start to turn golden add grated coocnut. Saute till the coconut starts to toast.
Add turmeric, red chilli powder, dhaniya powder, 1/2 tsp of the prepared garam masala and salt. Add a little water to prevent burning.
Add the tamarind extract and jaggery. Mix and add the corn roundels and the stove grilled capsicum. Add a little water, cover and cook till the water evaporates.
On top add some chopped coriander leaves, the char grilled capsicum, 1 tsp of the prepared garam masala and lemon juice.
Serve.

recipies.description: Here's a creamy paneer dish that you just can't get enough of! Paneer cubes cooked in rich gravy made with cashew nuts, khoya, cream, curd and coconut.
recipies.name: Paneer in White Gravy
method: Extract the juice of ginger and garlic and keep aside.
Grind onions separately, and the cashew nuts and coconut to a fine paste.
In a heavy bottomed pan place the ground paste, add salt, green cardamoms, ginger garlic juice and bring to boil, then simmer.
Cook until dry. Then add ghee and the beaten curd, and cook till fat separates.
Add the nut paste and fry for 2 to 3 minutes, taking care that the masala does not brown.
Then add white pepper and 1 1/2 cups of water, or enough to make a thick gravy.
Add paneer Simmer for a while. Remove from fire add kewra jal, and mashed khoya. Blend well.
Finally add the cream.
Serve hot garnished with silver leaf. Roomali roti is a good accompaniment for this dish.

recipies.description: Iguru means gravy cooked on slow fire and thickened. Here's a lobster recipe that you just can't resist.
ingredients: 1/4 tsp coriander powder pinch of turmeric powder
recipies.name: Lobster Iguru
method: Remove the meat from the lobster shell.
Marinate the lobster meat with turmeric powder, salt and lemon juice and keep it for about 15-20 minutes.
Grind chopped onions and red chillies together to a fine
Heat oil in pan. Add cumin seeds, mustard seeds, curry leaves, slit green chillies, prepared
Cook the
Then add chopped tomatoes, water and lobster meat.
Mix well and cook till it is done.
Lobster Iguru is ready to eat.
Garnish with coriander leaves and

recipies.description: Pomfret fillets coated with a cornmeal and mustard paste, fried in a spiced oil. Crusted with fried onions and served with aubergines, tomatoes and a little lemon juice.
ingredients: 1/2 kg onions - sliced and fried till golden
recipies.name: Onion Crusted Fish
method: To make the spiced oil, combine all the ingredients and leave for 2 weeks to steep.
Combine cornmeal and mustard.
Spread thinly over one side of the fillets.
Fry in the spiced oil.
Coat the topside of the fillets with fried onions.
Fry both sides of the fish.
Lightly fry chopped aubergines and tomatoes.
Add lemon juice and chopped parsley.
Serve with the fish.
recipies.cook_time: 45 Minutes + Time to make spiced oil

recipies.description: Black tiger prawns cooked with freshly crushed black Tellicherry pepper and other spices, served with mashed potato and sabodana papad.
ingredients: 10 black tiger prawns (approx 1/2 kg), head & shell off
recipies.name: Tellicherry Pepper Prawns Fry with Saboodana Papad
method: Devein the prawns and give a butterfly cut.
Wash thoroughly and pat dry.
Marinate in half oyster sauce and half lemon juice.
Add little tempura batter (2 tbsp) to the prawns.
Fry in hot oil till golden.
In a pan, heat oil and saute chopped ginger, garlic and bhunna masala.
Add water (6 tbsp) and add salt to the remaining oyster sauce.
Add crushed peppercorn and garam masala.
Reduce the sauce to coating consistency.
Add the crisp fried prawns and toss to coat evenly.
Add chopped coriander and finish with remaining lemon juice.
Add chopped coriander, salt and little black pepper to mashed potato.
Fry saboodana papad.
In serving plate, place quenelle of mashed potato and stand the fried sabodana papad on it.

recipies.description: Fish cooked in a gravy of yoghurt, poppy seeds and almonds
recipies.name: Machcher Dompokht
method: Rub in the salt into the fish pieces and saute lightly on low flame for a few minutes.
Mix all the ingredients except the chopped onion in the yoghurt and pour over the fish and marinate well.
Heat the
Simmer for about 5-6 minutes and then add a tsp of

recipies.description: Prawns cooked in spices and coconut milk, serve with rice for an authentic Bengali meal
recipies.name: Chingri Malai Curry
method: Blanch the prawns in turmeric water.
Heat mustard oil in a pan and add sugar and whole cumin.
Add ginger paste, cumin powder, red chilli powder and turmeric powder and sauté
Now add the prawns and slit green chillies and stir for few minutes.
Add the coconut milk, cook for few more minutes and then add salt.
In the end sprinkle

recipies.description: Yaki-nori sheet wrapped with rice, spicy sauce and tuna, served with wasabi and soya sauce.
ingredients: 1 sheet of yaki-nori or roasted seaweeds
1/4 cup short grain Japanese rice-cooked and mixed with vinegar, sugar and kombu seaweed
recipies.name: Spicy Maguro Maki
method: Place yaki-nori sheet on the bamboo mat and cover it with the rice.
Sprinkle the spring onion on top.
Now, pick it by the corners and quickly turn it over, so as to place it upside down.
Spread spicy sauce over it and then add tuna.
Lift the edges of the bamboo mat and roll it back and forth to seal the edges of yaki-nori.
Finally, slice the prepared roll into equal sizes and serve with wasabi and soya sauce.

recipies.description: Fish fillets cooked in coconut milk with aromatic spices. Served with rice tossed in desi ghee.
ingredients: 1/2 kg fillet or 1.5 whole pomfret fish
recipies.name: Meen Curry with Ghee Bhaat
method: Clean and wash fish fillet and cut into 2 inch cubes.

In a pan, heat oil. Add mustard seeds. Let it crackle and add chopped onion, chopped ginger, chopped garlic, curry leaves, salt, green chilli and turmeric powder. Let it cook for a minute, and then add tamarind pulp.
Add coconut milk. Once coconut milk starts to boil, add fish along with tomatoes and allow to simmer till almost cooked. (Approx 15 minutes)
To finish, sprinkle methi dana powder and ajwain powder. Add the tamarind pulp.
Remove from fire, squeeze lemon juice and adjust seasoning. Serve hot with ghee bhaat and roasted popadum.
Boil 2 cups water. Add soaked rice, and ghee.
Cook till done.

recipies.description: Crab meat cooked with masalas and rolled in a corn parantha, drizzled with a freshly made chutney.
ingredients: 2 Tbsp sweet corn paste (or 200 gm sweet corn)
3 bell peppers (red, yellow and green - 1 each)
recipies.name: Crab Wrapped in Corn Paratha
method: Make corn paste by grinding sweet corn.
In a bowl, mix egg white, sweet corn paste, salt, pepper and milk.
Cook like a roti in a pan with little oil.
Mix in with crab meat - ginger paste, garlic paste, garam masala, yoghurt, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, yellow chilli flakes, cream, olive oil, tomato paste, tomato ketchup.
Mix all and cook for 10 minutes till gravy-like.
Mix all chopped vegetables - tomato, sweet corn, green onion, red pepper, green pepper, yellow pepper, mango, fresh coriander, fresh mint with olive oil, salt, pepper, lemon juice.
Put crab meat in parantha. Roll it and spread chutney on top.

recipies.description: Happiness is home cooked food! A light serving of urad dal cooked with mild spices and desi ghee tempering.
recipies.name: Dhuli Urad ki Daal
method: Pick, clean and wash the lentils well, 2 or 3 times; place in a heavy-based pan with 4 cups of water, turmeric, ginger and salt.
Place the pan over high heat and cover partially. Bring to a boil and simmer till cooked. If using a pressure cooker, add only 3 cups of water, cook for 10 minutes and set aside.
Heat the clarified butter in a heavy-based pan; add the asafoetida and cumin seeds. When the cumin seeds begin to splutter, add the powdered coriander and the garam masala.
Mix well, add the lentils and bring to a boil. Simmer for about 1 minute. Transfer the lentils into a serving bowl.
In another smaller pan, heat 1 Tbsp of clarified butter and add the chilli powder and garnish the lentils. Sprinkle the chopped coriander leaves and serve hot.

recipies.description: Small pieces of tuna in mustard. Served with an oriental dipping sauce made with sesame oil, rosemary and red wine.
ingredients: 3-4 Tbsp of red wine/ brown rice vinegar
recipies.name: Tuna Sashimi Style
method: Cut the tuna into small pieces and bind it with mustard.
Mix the soy sauce, red wine, sesame oil, fish oil and chopped rosemary to make the dipping sauce.

recipies.description: Aditya Bal's Pune experience leads him to Sharvaree Parasnis who teaches him this authentic Maharashtrian pudachi wadi recipe. Besan casing stuffed with a onion-coriander filling with poppy seeds and copra.
ingredients: Hing, to taste (From a pinch to 1 tsp)
1 tbsp goda masala mixed with 1 tsp oil
recipies.name: Pudachi Wadi
method: In a pan dry roast poppy seeds and copra for 3-4 minutes. Cool. Grind in a mixie. Keep aside.
In a wok add oil. In the heated oil add mustard seeds, zeera, hing and turmeric. Let the seeds splutter.
Add the onions. Saute till pink.
Add the ginger-garlic paste, green chilli paste, charoli, red chilli powder, dhaniya powder, zeera powder, goda masala. Saute.
Add chopped coriander leaves and lemon juice. Saute.
Add the copra-poppy seed paste. Mix well. Keep aside.
In a bowl add besan, atta, salt, turmeric, zeera powder, dhaniya powder, red chilli powder. Knead with water. This dough need to be stiffer than the regular dough for chapatis.
Finish by kneading for 1 minute with a little oil. Your dough is ready.
Make flat rounds like you do for chapatis. Apply a little goda masala-oil. Place 2-3 Tbsp of the filling. Seal it from all sides.
Deep fry till golden.
Cut and serve with chutneys of our choice.

recipies.description: A sweet and sour brinjal curry. Fried brinjal bathed in a host of hot spices and pepped up with the tang of tamarind.
recipies.name: Khatte Meethe Baingan
method: Boil water and add sugar, according to taste and add the
Let it boil for about 10-15 minutes or till the mixture becomes thick in consistency.
Drain the mixture and keep aside.
First cut each
Heat oil, deep fry them and keep aside.
Heat 3-4 Tbsp of mustard oil, add heeng and ginger-garlic paste to it.
Add cumin seeds, whole red chilles and saunf powder, stir well.
Add tomato puree.
Mix in all the powdered masalas and salt.
Garnish with coriander leaves and pour the imli mixture over it.
Stir well and add the fried
Cover and cook for about 8-10 minutes.
Serve hot.

recipies.description: Relish the unusually ecstatic flavours of this Rajasthani raw mango curry along with the traditional Khoba roti.
ingredients: 3 cups coarse whole wheat flour + for dusting
recipies.name: Kairi Curry with Khoba Roti
method: Heat mustard oil in a non-stick pan till it smokes.
Add cumin seeds, fennel seeds and onion seeds, saute till the seeds crackle.
Add broken bay leaves and saute.
Add asafoetida, gram flour, turmeric powder, red chilli powder and coriander powder and mix well.
Add raw mangoes and a little water, mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add salt, mix well, cover and simmer for 10 minutes
Add jaggery to kairi ki curry and mix well.
Cook till the jaggery melts completely.
Transfer the curry in a serving bowl, garnish with coriander sprigs and serve hot with khoba roti.
Combine flour, salt and ghee in a bowl.
Add water as required and
Knead into a stiff dough, set aside for about 15 minutes.
Divide the dough into equal portions, place them on a dusted worktop and roll out into 6inch diameter rotis.
Pinch on the surface to get indentation all over, using ghee.
Heat a non-stick tawa and place roti on it, indent side down.
Cook on low heat till evenly browned and cooked.
Flip, drizzle some ghee all over and cook till other side is evenly browned and cooked.

recipies.description: Paneer, bell pepper, onions and zucchini marinated in a variety of spices, grilled on a tandoor/oven and served with hung curd dip.
ingredients: Handful of coriander leaves, finely chopped
recipies.name: Mix Vegetables and Cheese Skewers
method: Prepare the marinate.
In the grinder add garlic, green olives, chilli flakes, cumin, black pepper, few sprigs of basil leaves and salt. Grind it all together.
Add olive oil, red wine vinegar, and lemon juice, then mix it with the paste.
Thread onion, paneer, red bell pepper, zucchini and onion on the skewers sticks.
Massage marinate into the skewers.
Pre heat the grill pan and drizzle it with olive oil.
Gently lower the skewers into the pan and grill it.
8. In a bowl, add hung curd, olive oil, chilli powder, black pepper, lemon juice, salt, dill leaves, coriander leaves, honey and cucumber.
Mix it well and serve it with the skewers.

recipies.description: A chunky winter soup of diced bacon, okra, tomato, capsicum and corn.
recipies.name: Okra and Bacon Soup
method: Dice the bacon and place it in a saucepan and saute, till cooked.
Add the onions and saute till transparent.
Add the
Stir fry to mix well over high heat.
Add the stock and bring to a boil.
Lower the heat and simmer till the
Serve hot.

recipies.description: Undeniably, one of the most preferred soups.
recipies.name: Tomato Soup
method: Put the tomatoes, carrot and potato to boil with 1 cup water and salt.
Cook in a saucepan or a pressure cooker till the vegetables are completely cooked.
Remove from fire and when cool enough to handle, strain the vegetables through a soup strainer or blend in a blender.
Measure the liquid and add water to make up 4 1/2 cups.
Bring to a boil again, and then simmer.
Add sugar and black pepper.
Simmer for another 10 minutes.
While the soup is simmering, cut the bread into cubes and fry them in hot oil, till brown and crisp.
Pour the soup in bowls, and garnish with the cream.
Serve the croutons on the side.

recipies.description: Soft dough filled with your choice of filling and served in freshly made soup.
recipies.name: Wonton Soup
method: Knead the wonton dough with the ingredients and leave to rest.

*Trim the fat and bone off the meat and place it on a chopping board with the spring onions, ginger and garlic and mince with a sharp knife till a well-blended mass of mince is formed. Shape this mixture into marble-sized balls and keep aside.
Put the stock onto boil and then simmer.
Roll the dough till translucent and cut into 5 cm squares.
Fill the wontons.
Place the ball of meat in one corner of the square piece of dough.
Start rolling the meat in the cover till it reaches the center.
Now pinch the two rolled sides thus formed, thereby sealing off the meat completely in the cover.
In order to make the wontons vegetarian fill them with shredded cabbage.
Keep throwing the wontons into the simmering stock as you fill them they are all done.
Simmer till the wontons are cooked. They wrinkle up a little and the filling becomes firm. This generally takes about 15 minutes.
Add the rest of the soup ingredients, except the lettuce.
To serve, divide the lettuce into the bowls and pour the hot soup over.

recipies.description: Scoop up a spoonful of creamy puy lentil base, with water chestnut, carrots and more. It also flaunts a crumbly parmesan crust on top! This innovative dish has all the flavours of garlic, tomato, thyme and parsley.
recipies.name: Puy Lentil & Green Onion Crumble
method: To make the crumble, mix the butter with the flour till it resembles a coarse sand-like texture.
Then add the parmesan, chopped thyme, salt & pepper.
Mix again till fully combined and let it chill in the fridge.
For the Puy Lentil mixture, add oil in a pan, and sauté the garlic & onion. Add the carrot and cook till soft.
Now add in the green onion, followed by puy lentil. Do not forget to season at each step as you go. This will help to achieve a better taste.
Add the water chestnut and tomato concasse.
Add cream when it thickens up and turn the heat off.
Finish off by adding mustard & herbs.
Taste one last time and adjust the seasoning.
Preheat oven at 180 degree. In an ovenproof bowl, add in the lentil mixture and top it with crumble; bake for 15-20 minutes or till the top is nicely brown & bubbling.
Drizzle some extra virgin olive oil & enjoy.

recipies.description: A mix of kidney beans and warm spices, wrapped up in gram flour and deep fried to gorgeous brown. Serve these exquisite rajma kebabs to win over your love ones.
recipies.name: Rajma Kebab
method: Soak
Remove its skin by pouring boiling water over it.
Grind
Add chopped onion, green chillies, tomatoes, chilli powder, coriander powder, lemon juice, peanuts and salt.
Now add
Mix by hand and work into small rolls.
Deep fry in hot oil/ghee till golden brown.

recipies.description: Barley, button mushrooms and shiitake mushrooms come together with aromatic spices to give you a mouthwatering vegetarian delicacy.
recipies.name: Mushroom Khitchda (My Yellow Table)
method: Boil 1 cup of barley,
Chop onions, garlic, green chillies and mushrooms,
Take 100 gms butter in a pan and let it heat.
Add cumin, onions, garlic & green chillies,
Add button mushrooms followed by shiitake mushrooms,
Add some shiitake water, salt and black pepper, let it cook.
Garnish it with Coriander

recipies.description: A light and lovely serving of fish to celebrate Easter with. Fish fillets wrapped in herbs are baked and drizzled with a white wine and butter sauce. Simple but impressive!
recipies.name: Salmon Fillet with Vegetables
method: Take a butter paper/parchment paper and lay fennel stems and lemon slices on it.
Place the fish on it and top with leeks. Season and add parsley, thyme and coriander seeds.
Finish with butter and fold the paper tightly leaving one side open.
Pour in the wine and then seal the paper completely. Place in a pan and bake for 10 minutes.
For the sauce, open the butter paper and separate the liquid from the fish on to a pan.
Heat it for 2 minutes and then add white wine. Now add thyme and butter.
Finally add the vegetable stock.
Place the fish on a serving dish, pour the sauce on top and serve.

recipies.description: A wintery delight. Eggplant seasoned and char grilled, combined with tomato water and other seasonings to give you a tasty soup. Topped with a blob of whipped hung curd.
ingredients: 1 Tbsp green coriander stems, finely chopped
1 Tbsp fresh green coriander, finely chopped
A pinch of green cardamom powder
recipies.name: Charred Eggplant Soup
method: Season the eggplant with sea salt, pepper and olive oil and grill it till the skin has charred and soft.
Then cover and allow it to cool so the skin is easy to peel  off and discard the charred skin.
Coarsely mash the eggplant and keep aside.
Now heat the oil in a pan, add the cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add the onions and saute on medium heat till soft and translucent.
Add the garlic, green chillies and the ginger and saute for 1 minute.
Mix in the coriander powder, cumin powder, red chilli powder and garam masala.
Add the tomato water (To get tomato water blend 2 large tomatoes in 500 ml of water and strain.)
Stir well and cook for 3-5 minutes or till it reduces a little, stirring often to prevent the spice mix from sticking to the bottom of the pan.
Add the mashed eggplant into the pan and mix well.
Season with salt and cracked back pepper.
Add the chopped fresh coriander stems and stir.
Cook for another 10 minutes.
Using a hand blender, blend the ingredients in to a nice thick soup.
Garnish with a blob of whipped hung curd,  cardamom powder, coriander leaves and olive oil.

recipies.description: Flavoursome and rich Bombay duck marinated in a beautiful yellow paste and fried in rice batter till crisp. Despite its name, Bombay duck is not a duck but a type of lizardfish.
ingredients: Paste- grind some ginger, garlic and green chillies together
recipies.name: Bombay Duck
method: Make fillets of the Bombay duck.
Marinate in paste, turmeric, chilli powder, lemon juice and salt for 30 minutes.
Coat the fish with rice batter and deep fry until crisp.
The dish is ready to serve.

recipies.description: Chef Kunal Kapur's desi take on nachos with dip - simply lip smacking!
recipies.name: Eggplant Chokha Namak Para
method: Apply oil on to eggplants, tomatoes, onion & potato.
Roast all at 180˚ C.
Peel and smash into a nice mixture.
To this, add chopped chillies, coriander leaves, mustard oil & salt, mix well.
Knead a dough mixing together maida, ajwain, salt & olive oil.
Roll it out into a big roti & bake at 170˚ C for 15 minutes.
Once baked, break it into triangular pieces & serve it with the mashed vegetables dip.

recipies.description: Relish the taste of this authentic fish curry all the way from Karnataka. Lady fish marinated in fiery red chilli paste, coated in semolina and fried to a golden glory.
recipies.name: Kane Rava Fry
method: For the chilli paste:
Boil red chillies in water.
Strain the chillies and grind them to a thick paste.
Now add gingers, garlic paste, salt, lime juice, egg, and corn flour.
Clean the fish.
Apply red chilli paste on the inside and the outside of the fish.
Keep the fish aside for marination for about half an hour.
Then coat the marinated fish with semolina and deep fry till done.
Serve hot.

recipies.description: Savour the hot and spicy flavours of this Chinese vegetable manchow soup.
recipies.name: Vegetable Manchow Soup
method: In a pan, add some oil and stir fry the ginger, garlic, coriander leaves and green chilies for about two minutes.
Add all the vegetables, pepper, ajinomoto, salt and continue to stir-fry for two more minutes.
Add the Soya sauce, water and salt.
Let it boil, reduce the heat and add the cornflour mixed with water and stir constantly till it thickens slightly.
Remove from heat and serve immediately.
Garnish with spring onion stems.

recipies.description: Traditionally made with beef or pork, this dish is thought to date back to the late nineteenth century. This vegetarian version made with tofu is equally sumptuous and has beautiful textures. You can adjust the spice to suit your own taste and serve it hot.
recipies.name: Mapo Tofu with Spring Onion and Black Beans
method: Heat cooking oil and Sichuan oil in wok or pan, put chili bean paste, spicy black bean, sauté it.
Add ginger, garlic, chili powder and sauté for a while.
Add dark soy and water.
Put silken tofu, leeks, spring onion, and add sugar, let it boil for 2 minutes.
Meanwhile take a stainless steel bowl put potato starch and water to prepare thickening starch .
Adjust the thickening with potato starch and add it.
Serve hot

recipies.description: Marinated in a mix of spices and then grilled golden, this juicy fish fillet is perfect for a rainy day.
ingredients: 2 large fillets of basa portioned into 200gm each
2 tablespoon roasted and coarsely pounded coriander seeds
recipies.name: Sesame and Coriander Crusted Basa
method: Marinate the portioned basa with the rest of the ingredients for 30 minutes in the refrigerator. Don't marinate more than that as lemon juice is acidic in nature and will denature the proteins.
Grill on medium heat till it gets the grill mark. Turn over to grill mark the other side. Take it off the grill and let it cool for 3-5 minutes.
Plate and serve as it is with a lemon wedge or the salad of your choice.

recipies.description: Juicy sea bass fillets are fried to perfection and served along with a flavorful chutney made of strawberries, balsamic vinegar, cumin and other aromatics.
recipies.name: Kasundi Sea Bass With Strawberry Chutney
method: Season the fish with salt & pepper powder & fry it in olive oil.
In another pan add chopped strawberries, balsamic vinegar,
Add fish on a platter of greens.
Pour some mustard sauce mixed with olive oil on it followed by strawberry chutney.
